revision.text:
{{Infobox convention | name = The 10th World Science Fiction Convention | image = | caption = | status = | genre = [[Science fiction]] | venue = Morrison Hotel | location = [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]] | country = United States | first = August 30 – September 1, 1952 | last = | organizer = | filing = non-profit | attendance = 870 | website = }} The '''10th World Science Fiction Convention''' was held on [[Labor Day]] weekend from August 30 to September 1, 1952, at the Morrison Hotel in [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]]. This Worldcon never chose an official name other than the title "10th World Science Fiction Convention," as both the convention's issued membership card and program book clearly stated. Only the first Worldcon in New York City (1939) and the 11th in Philadelphia, 1953, shared this lack of a formal convention name. The phrases "Tenth Anniversary World Science Fiction Convention" (TAWSFiC) and "Tenth Anniversary Science Fiction Convention" (TASFiC, likely a simple [[Linotype machine|linotype]] error, as "World" is missing) were each used in some of this Worldcon's pre-convention materials; the phrase's acronyms "TAWSFiC" and "TASFiC" were never officially used in print or otherwise by the Chicago committee at that time. However, the 10th Worldcon ''was'' frequently referred to by its members by the unofficial name '''Chicon II''', so dubbed after the previous Chicago [[Worldcon]] ('''Chicon''') in 1940; this name proved so popular that the convention became known as Chicon II in [[science fiction fandom]]'s lore and written histories. The convention chair was [[Julian May|Julian C. May]] (later also known as Judy Dikty). [[Hugo Gernsback]] was the convention's official guest of honor. The program included the performance of an original science fiction ballet. For years this Worldcon held the record for the largest attendance at any early science fiction convention, with 870 registered attendees, a figure which was not surpassed by another Worldcon until 1967 for [[27th World Science Fiction Convention|Nycon 3]] in New York City. By way of comparison, the previous year's Worldcon, the [[9th World Science Fiction Convention|Nolacon]] in [[New Orleans]], had an attendance of 190. It was at this Worldcon that the idea for the [[Hugo Award|Hugo]] science fiction awards was first proposed and adopted. These awards, the highest and oldest honor in science fiction, were first awarded at the 1953 Worldcon in Philadelphia. The convention is said to have been the place where [[Sturgeon's Law]] was first formulated (although other origin stories claim Sturgeon first articulated the concept in 1951, a year earlier). During a panel discussion on science fiction, one of the panelists observed that about 90% of science fiction was crud. [[Theodore Sturgeon]], also on the panel, replied that 90% of ''everything'' was crud. ==See also== *[[Worldcon]] *[[World Science Fiction Society]] ==References== {{reflist|refs= {{cite web |work=Notes on the Long List of Worldcons |publisher=[[World Science Fiction Society]] |title=1952 - TASFiC |url=http://www.smofinfo.com/LL/LongListNotes.html#1952 |accessdate=March 7, 2011}} }} ==Further reading== {{refbegin}} *{{cite book |editor-last=Ash |editor-first=Brian |year=1977 |work=The Visual Encyclopedia of Science Fiction |location=London |publisher=[[Pan Books]] |title=Chicon}} *{{cite news |first=Annabelle |last=Gould |work=[[Chicago Daily Tribune]] |title=Science Fiction Session Is Out Of This World |page=8 |url=http://archives.chicagotribune.com/1952/08/31/page/8/article/science-fiction-session-is-out-of-this-world |date=August 31, 1952}} *{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Reinsberg |work=[[Chicago Daily Tribune]] |title=Avid Science, Fiction Fans Meet in City |page=G7 |url=http://archives.chicagotribune.com/1952/08/31/page/159/article/avid-science-fiction-fans-meet-in-city |date=August 31, 1952}} *Warner, Jr., Harry. ''A Wealth of Fable: An Informal History of Science Fiction Fandom in the 1950s''. SciFi Press, Van Nuys, CA., 1992. {{ISBN|0-9633099-0-0}}. *{{cite news |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |title=S.-F. Fan's Special: Deeds to Moon Craters |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/djreprints/access/81426931.html?dids=81426931:81426931&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:AI |date=September 3, 1952 |accessdate=January 19, 2011 |quote=Do you want a "warranty deed" to a crater on the moon? If so, contact one of the 1,000 space lovers who attended the Tenth Annual World Science Fiction Convention here last weekend. Each got an elaborate scroll attesting to lunar colonization rights when they paid the $1 registration fee.}} {{refend}} ==External links== *{{cite web|url= http://www.chicon.org/docs/TASFIC%20program.pdf |title=TAWSFiC program book }} *[http://www.smofinfo.com/LL/TheLongList.html SmofInfo: The Long List of Worldcons] {{s-start}} {{succession box | before=[[9th World Science Fiction Convention]]
Nolacon I in [[New Orleans]], United States (1951) | title=[[List of Worldcons]] | years='''10th World Science Fiction Convention'''
Chicon II in [[Chicago]], United States (1952) | after=[[11th World Science Fiction Convention]]
Philcon II in [[Philadelphia]], United States (1953) }} {{s-end}} {{World Science Fiction Convention}} {{DEFAULTSORT:World Science Fiction Convention 010}} [[Category:1952 in the United States]] [[Category:Science fiction conventions in the United States]] [[Category:Culture of Chicago]] [[Category:World Science Fiction Convention]] [[Category:1952 in Illinois]] [[Category:1952 conferences]] [[Category:August 1952 events]] [[Category:September 1952 events]]

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=October 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Infobox civilian attack | title = 1985 Lahad Datu ambush | partof = [[Piracy in Asia]] and [[Cross border attacks in Sabah]] | image = | alt = | caption = | location = [[Lahad Datu]], [[Sabah]] | coordinates = {{coord|5|1|48|N|118|20|24|E|region:MY_type:event|display=inline,title}} | date = 23 September 1985 – 24 September 1985
({{Age in years, months, weeks and days|month1=09|day1=23|year1=1985|month2=09|day2=24|year2=1985}}) | time = Afternoon until next morning | timezone = [[UTC]]+8 | type = [[Bank robbery]], [[robbery]], [[Mass shooting|random shootings]] | fatalities = 21 (excluding 5 perpetrators) | injuries = 11 (excluding 2 perpetrators) | perps = [[Moro Pirates]] from the Southern Philippines | weapons = [[M16 rifle|M16]], [[carbines]], [[machine guns]], [[rocket launchers]] and [[hand grenades]] | motive = Robbery }} {{Campaignbox Piracy in Asia}} The '''1985 Lahad Datu ambush''' is a series of robbery and [[Mass shooting|random shootings]] that occurred on 23 September 1985 when 15-20{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1309&dat=19870924&id=emNPAAAAIBAJ&sjid=DZADAAAAIBAJ&pg=4938,4898789|title=Lahad Datu Recalls Its Blackest Monday|publisher=[[New Straits Times]]|date=24 September 1987|accessdate=30 October 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1301&dat=19851030&id=fjZWAAAAIBAJ&sjid=KugDAAAAIBAJ&pg=2040,10656153|title=Filipino pirates wreak havoc in a Malaysian island paradise|author=Masayuki Doi|publisher=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=30 October 1985|accessdate=30 October 2014}} armed [[Moro Pirates|foreign pirates]] landed on the coast of [[Lahad Datu]] and stormed in the town. The pirates shot at random targets, killing at least 21 people and injuring 11 others, and snatched some $200,000 from a local bank as well as another $5,000 from the [[Malaysia Airlines]] office.{{cite web|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Opinion/Columnists/OK-Bah/Profile/Articles/2014/02/19/Thoughts-on-Sabahs-piracy-problem/|title=Thoughts on Sabah’s piracy problem|author=Clement Jaikul|publisher=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=19 February 2014|accessdate=30 October 2014}} == Background == Most areas in the east coast of Sabah are known for many [[Filipino people|Filipino]] communities, both legal and [[Illegal immigrants in Malaysia|illegal]]. These areas have become the haven for pirates from the Philippines and Sabah itself has suffered 10 major attacks since 1976.{{cite web|url=http://jati-dseas.um.edu.my/filebank/published_article/4259/12.%20171-188%20Ramli..%20Lanun%20Atau%20Mundu%20Di%20Sabah..%20Jati%209.pdf|title=Lanun atau Mundu di Sabah|publisher=[[University of Malaya]]|date=9 December 2004|accessdate=30 October 2014|author=Ramli Dollah|language=ms|pages=176 and 178 (6 and 8)|format=[[PDF]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141030060419/http://jati-dseas.um.edu.my/filebank/published_article/4259/12.%20171-188%20Ramli..%20Lanun%20Atau%20Mundu%20Di%20Sabah..%20Jati%209.pdf|archive-date=30 October 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 23 September evening, suddenly a number of armed men clad in [[jungle green]] uniforms appeared in the town and started to shoot random targets. The shoot-out left the town with destruction and blood could be found anywhere. One of the victims, a pregnant woman, was shot when she was being driven home in a [[van]]. The van driver brought her to the hospital but she was pronounced dead on arrival. Another victim, a [[Malaysian Chinese|Chinese]], was injured by a gunshot during the raid. During an interviewed with him, he told.. {{cquote|While I was walking around a coastal road, I saw eight men dressed in combat uniforms carrying [[M16 rifle|M16]] and [[machine guns]] running towards the centre of the town. Gunfire was then heard with men running towards me. I then hid in a cafe with the proprietor, huddled under a table and heard the continuous gunshots and explosions. I thought the town was under attack by the [[Philippine Army]]. Suddenly, I heard a bullet crashing the window and saw my leg was hit with it. I saw images of my wife and three children and I thought I would never see them again. But later I consider myself fortunate because I lived to see my family. But even so, I cannot help wondering about [[Government of Malaysia|our government]], which can’t seem to defend us against these marauders.}} The instability of the Philippines has caused major economic problems for Sabah. Philippine army raids against anti-[[Ferdinand Marcos|Marcos]] factions in the [[Sulu Archipelago|Sulu]] and [[Mindanao]] island have left many houses and fields destroyed, forcing an estimated 100,000 [[Moro people]] in the Southern Philippines to flee to Sabah. While many who have not left the Philippine islands have involved in criminal activities, mainly on [[smuggling]] and armed robbery. == Aftermath == After their successful attempt, the pirates later retreated to a jetty where they engaging a group of [[Marine Operations Force|Malaysian Marine Police]]. Two of the pirates were wounded during a gun battle with the marine police which their friends still managed to carry their injured friends into two awaiting [[pump boats]] as the pirates made their getaway back to the Philippines. In the next day, the Marine Police launched a surprise attacks on an island which believe to be their hide-out and managed to kill five pirates. While the rest of the pirates have escaped to the [[Malaysia–Philippines border|international border]], the police recovered a number of M16 rifles with a whole armoury of assorted weapons. Some ambiguous source alleged on the apparent retaliation, the [[Royal Malaysian Navy]] with four ships and three helicopters attacked a Filipino island, bombed the island's settlement, burning houses and killing 53 Filipino residents.{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1345&dat=19850930&id=6vpLAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ovkDAAAAIBAJ&pg=4616,3601850|title=Moslem community attacked in raid?|publisher=[[Spokane Chronicle]]|date=30 September 1985|accessdate=30 October 2014}} The Malaysian Embassy in [[Manila]] declined to comment on the report and said the Malaysian embassy has not received any information from the Philippine government or from the Malaysia's capital of [[Kuala Lumpur]]. == Reactions == * {{flag|Malaysia}} – The [[Government of Malaysia|Malaysian Government]] denied the reports on the retaliation attack to a Filipino island with both the Malaysian and Philippine government hinted that an unnamed third party was responsible for the incident. * {{flag|Philippines|1985}} – The [[Government of the Philippines|Philippine Government]] protested the [[Marine Operations Force|Malaysian Marine Police]] action during the chasing of the pirates to the international border, saying the Malaysian police had breached the Philippines border. However, this allegation was retracted since there were no concrete proofs. == See also == * [[Anti-Filipino sentiment#Sabah|Anti-Filipino sentiment § Sabah]] * [[History of Sabah]] {{Portal bar|1980s|Sabah|Malaysia|Philippines|Crime|Piracy|Terrorism}} == References == {{Pirates}} {{Moro internal issues}} {{Terrorism in Malaysia}} {{Navboxes |title = Links to related articles |list = {{Royal Malaysian Police Force}} {{History of East Malaysia}} }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lahad Datu ambush, 1985}} [[Category:1985 in international relations]] [[Category:1985 in Malaysia]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1985]] [[Category:Mass murder in 1985]] [[Category:Diplomatic incidents]] [[Category:History of Sabah]] [[Category:Malaysia–Philippines relations]] [[Category:Maritime incidents in 1985]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in 1985]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Malaysia]] [[Category:Ambushes]] [[Category:September 1985 events]]

| First_Team = [[Team Penske]] | Network = [[NASCAR on NBC|NBC]] | Announcers = [[Steve Letarte]], [[Jeff Burton]] and [[Dale Earnhardt Jr.]] (booth)
[[Rick Allen (sportscaster)|Rick Allen]], [[Dale Jarrett]] and [[Kyle Petty]] (NBC Peacock Pitbox) | Ratings = 1.5 (Overnight){{cite web |title=Darlington final TV ratings |url=http://www.espn.com/jayski/cup/2018/story/_/id/24576260/darlington-tv-ratings |website=[[Jayski's Silly Season Site |publisher=[[ESPN]] |accessdate=4 October 2018}} | Radio = [[Motor Racing Network|MRN]] | Booth_Ann = Joe Moore, Jeff Striegle and [[Rusty Wallace]] | Turn_Ann = [[Dave Moody (sportscaster)|Dave Moody]] (1 & 2) and [[Mike Bagley]] (3 & 4) }} The '''2018 Bojangles' Southern 500''', the 69th running of the [[Bojangles' Southern 500|event]] was a [[Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series]] [[Bojangles' Southern 500|race]] held on September 2, 2018, at [[Darlington Raceway]] in [[Darlington, South Carolina]]. Contested over 367 laps on the {{convert|1.366|mi|km|adj=on}} egg-shaped oval, it was be the 25th race of the [[2018 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series]] season. ==Report== ===Background=== [[File:Darlington raceway.svg|thumb|left|Layout of Darlington Raceway, the track where the race is held.]] '''Darlington Raceway''' is a [[race track]] built for [[NASCAR]] racing located near [[Darlington, South Carolina]]. It is nicknamed '''"The Lady in Black"''' and '''"The Track Too Tough to Tame"''' by many NASCAR fans and drivers and advertised as "A NASCAR Tradition." It is of a unique, somewhat egg-shaped design, an oval with the ends of very different configurations, a condition which supposedly arose from the proximity of one end of the track to a minnow pond the owner refused to relocate. This situation makes it very challenging for the crews to set up their cars' handling in a way that is effective at both ends. {{clear}} ====Entry list==== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%" |- ! {{Tooltip|No.|Car number}} ! [[Steve Letarte]], two–time Darlington winner [[Jeff Burton]] and [[Dale Earnhardt Jr.]] had the call in the booth for the race. [[Rick Allen (sportscaster)|Rick Allen]], three-time Darlington winner [[Dale Jarrett]] and [[Kyle Petty]] called from the NBC Peacock Pit Box on pit road. Jarrett and Petty also join Earnhardt in the booth for a portion of the race. Dave Burns, [[Parker Kligerman]], [[Marty Snider]] and Kelli Stavast reported from pit lane during the race. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !colspan="2"|[[NASCAR on NBC|NBCSN]] |- !Booth announcers!!Pit reporters |- | '''Lap-by-lap:''' [[Steve Letarte]]

[[Parker Kligerman]]

Kelli Stavast |} ===Radio=== The [[Motor Racing Network]] had the radio call for the race, which was simulcast on Sirius XM NASCAR Radio. revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=October 2017}} {{pp-semi-indef}} {{pp-move-indef}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Infobox criminal |birth_name = Mohammed Ajmal Amir Kasab |native_name = اجمل قصاب |image_name = Mohammed Ajmal Kasab.jpg |image_caption = Kasab in the [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus]] during the [[2008 Mumbai attacks]] |birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1987|7|13}} |birth_place = [[Faridkot, Okara]], [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]], Pakistan |death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|2012|11|21|1987|7|13}} |death_place = [[Pune]], Maharashtra, [[India]]{{Cite journal|url=http://www.businessweek.com/news/2012-11-20/mumbai-gunman-kasab-hanged-on-four-year-anniversary-of-attack|title=Mumbai gunman Kasab hanged on four-year anniversary of attack|work=Business Week|accessdate=21 November 2012|ref=harv|postscript={{inconsistent citations}}}} |cause = Execution by [[hanging]] |nationality = [[Pakistani]] |religion = [[Islam]] |motive = Terrorism |charge = |conviction = Murder
Conspiracy
Waging war against [[India]]
Possession of explosives |conviction_penalty = Death |conviction_status = Executed by [[hanging]] at 7:30 a.m. ([[Indian Standard Time|IST]]) on 21 November 2012
Place – [[Yerwada Central Jail]], [[Pune]]{{Cite journal |url=http://news.oneindia.in/2012/11/21/ajmal-kasav-executed-in-pune-jail-1102024.html|title=Ajmal Kasab hanged today at 7:30 am (0200 GMT) today|publisher=oneindia|accessdate=21 November 2012|ref=harv|postscript={{inconsistent citations}}}}{{cite web|url=http://in.news.yahoo.com/ajmal-kasab-hanged-at-pune-s-yerawada-jail--031157919.html|title=Ajmal Kasab hanged at Pune's Yerawada Jail|publisher=Yahoo! News|accessdate=21 November 2012}} }} '''Mohammed Ajmal Amir Kasab''' ({{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|محمد اجمل امیر قصاب}}}}) ‎; 13 July 1987 – 21 November 2012) was a Pakistani terrorist and a member of the [[Lashkar-e-Taiba]] [[Islamism|Islamist]] group, through which he took part in the [[2008 Mumbai attacks|2008 Mumbai terrorist attacks]] in Maharashtra state of India.{{cite news|title=Planned 9/11 at Taj: Caught Terrorist |url=http://www.zeenews.com/nation/2008-11-29/487150news.html |publisher=Zee News |date=29 November 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081225174923/http://www.zeenews.com/nation/2008-11-29/487150news.html |archivedate=25 December 2008 }}{{cite news|title=Please give me saline |url=http://www.bangaloremirror.com/index.aspx?page=article§id=1&contentid=2008112920081129095627277cedee9e0§xslt= |work=Bangalore Mirror |date=29 November 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090302112856/http://www.bangaloremirror.com/index.aspx?page=article§id=1&contentid=2008112920081129095627277cedee9e0§xslt= |archivedate=2 March 2009 }} Kasab was the only attacker captured alive by police. Kasab was born in [[Faridkot, Okara|Faridkot]], Pakistan to a family belonging to the [[Qassab|Qassab community]]. He left his home in 2005, engaging in petty crime and armed robbery with a friend. In late 2007, he and his friend encountered members of [[Jama'at-ud-Da'wah]], the political wing of [[Lashkar-e-Taiba]], distributing pamphlets, and were persuaded to join. On 3 May 2010, Kasab was found guilty of 80 offences, including murder, waging war against India, possessing explosives, and other charges.{{cite news|title=Bombay HC upholds Kasab's death sentence|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/2611-bombay-hc-upholds-kasabs-death-penalty/143895-3.html|publisher=IBN Live}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8657642.stm|title= Surviving Mumbai gunman convicted over attacks|last=Irani |first=Delnaaz |date=3 May 2010|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=3 May 2010|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100505141356/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8657642.stm| archivedate= 5 May 2010 |deadurl= no}} On 6 May 2010, the same trial court sentenced him to death on four counts and to a life sentence on five counts. Kasab's death sentence was upheld by the [[Bombay High Court]] on 21 February 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/article1478204.ece|title= Kasab waged war against India: court |work=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=22 February 2011|location=Chennai, India|date=22 February 2011}} The verdict was upheld by the [[Supreme Court of India]] on 29 August 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/26-11-terror-attacks-case-sc-upholds-kasabs-death-sentence/994747/|title=26/11 terror attacks case: Ajmal Kasab's plea to spare life rejected by SC|newspaper=[[The Indian Express]]|date=29 August 2012|accessdate=29 August 2012}} Kasab was hanged on 21 November 2012 at 7:30 am.{{cite web|url=http://www.mumbaivoice.com/ajmal-kasab-hanged-today-at-730-am-today|title=Ajmal Kasab hanged today at 7:30 am today|publisher=Mumbai Voice|accessdate=21 November 2012|ref=harv|postscript={{inconsistent citations}}}}{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} and buried at [[Yerwada Jail]] in [[Pune]].{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-11-21/india/35257796_1_mohammad-ajmal-kasab-mumbai-attacks-vishnu-zende|title=Kasab executed in great secrecy, Shinde says even Manmohan, Sonia didn't know|accessdate=21 November 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bankingawareness.com/current-affairs/ajmal-kasab-hanged/|title=Ajmal Kasab hanged and buried in Pune's Yerwada Jail|accessdate=21 November 2012|ref=harv|postscript={{inconsistent citations}}}} ==Early life== Kasab was born in [[Faridkot, Okara|Faridkot]] village in the [[Okara District]] of [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]], Pakistan, to Amir Shahban Kasab and Noor Illahi.{{harvnb|Baweja|2009|p=118}} His father ran a snack cart{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/print?id=6385015|title=Mumbai Terrorist Wanted to 'Kill and Die' and Become Famous}}{{cite news|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/News/PoliticsNation/Captured_Terrorist_Ajmal_Amir_Kasav_tells_his_story/articleshow/3786708.cms|title=Captured Terrorist Ajmal Amir Kasav tells his story|work=The Times of India|date=3 December 2008}} while his elder brother, Afzal, worked as a labourer in [[Lahore]]. His elder sister, Rukaiyya Husain, was married and lived in the village. A younger sister, Suraiyya, and brother, Munir, lived in Faridkot with their parents.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-03/india/27922070_1_lashkar-mumbai-terror-attacks-kuber|title=We were reassured of escape after the attack: Kasab|work=The Times of India|first1=Rahul|last1=Tripathi|date=3 December 2008}} The family belongs to the [[Qassab]] community. Kasab briefly joined his brother in [[Lahore]] and then returned to Faridkot.{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/from-petty-thief-in-multan-to-terror-face-in-.../393264/|title=From petty thief in Multan to terror face in India}}{{cite web|url=http://themoderatevoice.com/places/europe/united-kingdom/24701/mumbai-update-1100-am-est/|title=The Moderate Voice, quoting New York Times|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081203032924/http://themoderatevoice.com/places/europe/united-kingdom/24701/mumbai-update-1100-am-est/|archivedate=3 December 2008|df=dmy-all}} He left home after a fight with his father in 2005. He had asked for new clothes on [[Eid ul-Fitr|Eid]], but his father could not provide them, which made him angry.{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200812121323.htm |title=Ajmal is my son, says Mumbai attacker's father |location=Chennai, India |work=The Hindu |date=12 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081214195502/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200812121323.htm |archivedate=14 December 2008 }} He engaged in petty crime with his friend Muzaffar Lal Khan, moving on to armed robbery. On 21 December 2007, [[Eid al-Adha]], they were in Rawalpindi trying to buy weapons when they encountered members of [[Jama'at-ud-Da'wah]], the political wing of Lashkar-e-Taiba, distributing pamphlets. They decided to sign up for training with the Lashkar-e-Taiba, ending up at their base camp, Markaz Taiba. An interrogator and deputy commissioner of the [[Mumbai Police]] stated that Kasab spoke rough [[Hindi language|Hindi]] and almost no English.{{cite news|first=Rhys |last=Blakely|title=Mumbai police to use truth serum on 'baby-faced' terrorist Azam Amir Kasab |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5280084.ece |work=The Times|date=3 December 2008 |accessdate=3 December 2008|location=London}}{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5272189.ece|title=Father of Mumbai gunman, Azam Amir Kasab, 'paid by terrorists to hand him over'|location=London|work=The Times|date=2 December 2008| accessdate=23 April 2010|first=Rhys|last=Blakely}} He said his father in effect sold him to Lashkar-e-Taiba so that he could use the money they gave him to support the family.{{cite web | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JDROrLtc6GM&t=46m18s | title = Terror in Mumbai}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/report.asp?newsid=1210832|title=Kasab says his father sent him to LeT}}{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5274161.ece|title=CCTV shows start of Mumbai massacre|location=London|work=The Times|date=2 December 2008|accessdate=23 April 2010|first1=Rhys|last1=Blakely}} His father denied it.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-13/pakistan/27896905_1_ajmal-amir-kasab-mumbai-operation|title=Interview with Ajmal Amir's Father|work=The Times of India|date=13 December 2008}} [[Zaki-ur-Rehman Lakhvi]], a senior commander of the [[Lashkar-e-Taiba]], reportedly offered to pay his family [[Pakistani Rupee|Rs.]]150,000 for his participation in the attacks.{{cite news|last=Swami|first=Praveen| title=Pakistan now holds the key to probe: investigators|work=The Hindu|date=1 December 2008|url= http://www.hindu.com/2008/12/01/stories/2008120157370100.htm|accessdate =1 December 2008|location=Chennai|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081201173633/http://www.hindu.com/2008/12/01/stories/2008120157370100.htm|archivedate=1 December 2008 |deadurl= no}} Another report said the 23-year-old was recruited from his home, in part, based on a pledge by recruiters to pay [[Pakistani Rupee|Rs.]]100,000 to his family if he became a martyr.{{cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=97621922|title=Bombs found in Mumbai train station a week later|date=3 December 2008|accessdate=3 December 2008|publisher=[[NPR]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081205010021/http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=97621922|archivedate=5 December 2008|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} Other sources put the reward at US$4,000. Villagers of Okara claimed on camera that he was at their village six months before the Mumbai attack. They said that he asked his mother to bless him as he was going for Jihad, and claimed that he demonstrated his wrestling skills to a few village boys that day.{{cite web|url=http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/I-am-going-away-for-jihad-Kasab-told-his-mother-in-Pak/398067/|title=Kasab told his mother that he was going away for Jihad|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090221181859/http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/I-am-going-away-for-jihad-Kasab-told-his-mother-in-Pak/398067/|archivedate=21 February 2009|df=dmy-all}} ==Training== {{Main article|2008 Mumbai attacks#Training}} Ajmal Kasab was among a group of 24 men{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5265938.ece|title=City fears five terrorists are missing| location=London|work=The Times|date=2 December 2008|accessdate=23 April 2010|first=Rhys|last=Blakely}}{{subscription required|date=November 2012}} who received training in marine warfare at a remote camp in mountainous [[Muzaffarabad]], [[Azad Kashmir]] in Pakistan. Part of the training was reported to have taken place on the [[Mangla Dam]] reservoir.{{cite news|last = Rahman|first=Maseeh|author2=Jones, Sam|title=Rumours abound as inquiry begins its search for truth|work=The Guardian|date=1 December 2008|url= https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/01/mumbai-terror-attacks-india-pakistan1|accessdate=1 December 2008|location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081202011506/http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2008/dec/01/mumbai-terror-attacks-india-pakistan1|archivedate=2 December 2008 | deadurl= no}} ==Involvement in 2008 Mumbai attacks== Kasab was seen on [[Closed-circuit television|CCTV]] during his attacks at [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus]] along with another recruit, Ismail Khan. Kasab reportedly told the police that they wanted to replicate the [[Islamabad]] [[Islamabad Marriott Hotel bombing|Marriott hotel attack]], and reduce the Taj Hotel to rubble, replicating the [[9/11 attacks]] in India. Kasab and his accomplice Khan, then aged 25, attacked the [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus]] (formerly Victoria Terminus) railway station. They then moved on to attack a police vehicle (a white [[Toyota Kijang|Toyota Qualis]]) at [[Cama Hospital]], in which senior Mumbai police officers ([[Maharashtra]] [[Anti Terrorist Squad (India)|ATS]] Chief [[Hemant Karkare]], encounter specialist [[Vijay Salaskar]] and Additional Commissioner of Mumbai Police [[Ashok Kamte]]) were travelling. After killing them in a gun battle and taking two constables hostage{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}} in the Qualis, Kasab and Khan drove towards the Metro cinema. Kasab joked about the bulletproof vests worn by the police and killed one constable when his mobile phone rang. The two fired some shots into a crowd gathered at the Metro Cinema. They then drove to Vidhan Bhavan where they fired more shots. Their vehicle had a tire puncture, so they stole a silver [[Škoda Laura]] and drove towards [[Girgaum Chowpatty]] beach.{{Citation needed|date=December 2008}} The D B Marg{{clarify|reason=This appears to be the name of a police station|date=July 2016}} police had received a message from police control at about {{Nowrap|10 pm}}, that two heavily armed men had gunned down commuters at CST. 15 policemen from D B Marg were sent to Chowpatty to set up a double barricade on Marine Drive.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-09/mumbai/27923425_1_lathis-terrorists-policemen|title=Police overcomes deadly terrorists at Chowpatty|work=The Times of India|date=9 December 2008}} The Škoda reached Chowpatty and halted 40 to 50 feet from the barricade. It reversed and attempted a U-turn. A shootout ensued and Khan was killed. Kasab lay motionless playing dead. Assistant sub-inspector [[Tukaram Omble]], armed only with a [[Fighting stick|lathi]], charged the vehicle, being shot five times. Omble held onto Kasab's weapon, enabling Omble's colleagues to capture Kasab alive.{{cite web|url=http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/mumbaiterrorstrike/Story.aspx?ID=NEWEN20080076384&type=News |title=Saluting a braveheart, the man who helped capture Qasab |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081214135446/http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/mumbaiterrorstrike/Story.aspx?ID=NEWEN20080076384&type=News |archivedate=14 December 2008 |df=dmy }} Omble died from the bullet wounds. A mob gathered and attacked the two terrorists, which was captured on video.{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/World-News/Mumbai-Terror-Attacks-Sky-News-Gets-Exclusive-Footage-Of-Gun-Suspect-Ajmal-Qasabs-Arrest/Article/200812115168244?lpos=World_News_News_Your_Way_Region_6&lid=NewsYourWay_ARTICLE_15168244_Mumbai_Terror_Attacks%3A_Sky_News_Gets_Exclusive_Footage_Of_Gun_Suspect_Ajmal_Qasabs_Arrest |title=Sky News Footgage of gun suspect Ajmal Qasab's arrest |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081202012314/http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/World-News/Mumbai-Terror-Attacks-Sky-News-Gets-Exclusive-Footage-Of-Gun-Suspect-Ajmal-Qasabs-Arrest/Article/200812115168244?lpos=World_News_News_Your_Way_Region_6&lid=NewsYourWay_ARTICLE_15168244_Mumbai_Terror_Attacks%3A_Sky_News_Gets_Exclusive_Footage_Of_Gun_Suspect_Ajmal_Qasabs_Arrest |archivedate=2 December 2008 }} Initially Kasab pretended to be dead and was being transported to the [[Topiwala National Medical College and Nair Hospital|Nair Hospital]] when a police officer discovered Kasab was breathing. Seeing the mutilated body of another slain terrorist Kasab begged doctors to put him on saline, saying "I do not want to die".{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/11292008/news/worldnews/india_terror_timeline_141432.htm|title=Terrorist: 'I Do not Wanna Die'; Mumbai Mass Killer Turns Coward|last=Fanelli|first=James|date=30 November 2008|work=New York Post|accessdate=30 November 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081203054855/http://www.nypost.com/seven/11292008/news/worldnews/india_terror_timeline_141432.htm|archivedate=3 December 2008|df=dmy-all}} The doctors who treated Kasab said he had no bullet wounds.{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/No-bullet-hit-Kasab--no-active-treatment-on--says-hospital-s-dean/393116|title=No bullet hit Kasab, no active treatment on, says hospital's dean}} Kasab told police he was trained to "kill to the last breath",{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/world/we-wanted-to-kill-5000-surviving-terrorist-says/2008/11/30/1227979845539.html?page=2|title=We wanted to kill 5000, says surviving terrorist|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|date=1 December 2008}} Later, after interrogation in the hospital by the police, he said: "Now, I do not want to live", requesting the interrogators to kill him for the safety of his family in Pakistan, who could be killed or tortured for his surrender to Indian police. ([[Suicide attack|Fidayeen suicide squad]] terrorists were instructed not to be captured and interrogated, use aliases instead of their real names, and hide their nationality.{{cite web|url=http://www.themalaysianinsider.com/index.php/world/13499-terrorists-posed-as-malaysian-students|title=Straits Times article|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201005054/http://www.themalaysianinsider.com/index.php/world/13499-terrorists-posed-as-malaysian-students|archivedate=1 December 2008|df=dmy-all}} He is also quoted as saying "I have done right, I have no regrets". Reports also surfaced that the group planned to escape safely after the attack.) Kasab told interrogators that all through the operation, the Lashkar headquarters from [[Karachi, Pakistan]], remained in touch with the group, calling their phones through a voice-over-internet service. Investigators succeeded in reconstructing the group's journey through the [[Garmin]] [[GPS]] that was found on Kasab. The email sent from a group calling itself the [[Deccan Mujahideen]] claiming responsibility was traced to a Russian proxy which was traced back to [[Lahore]] with the help of the [[FBI]].{{cite news|url=http://www.ptinews.com/pti%5Cptisite.nsf/0/99F16988F6BDB91165257511003FB3F5?OpenDocument|title=Lashker-e-Taiba members learnt Hindi before Mumbai attacks|date=30 November 2008|agency=Press Trust of India|accessdate=5 December 2008}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-02/india/27948426_1_terror-attacks-terror-mail-serial-blasts|title=Terror mail routed through Pakistan's Lahore|date=2 December 2008|work=The Times of India|accessdate=5 December 2008}} ===Nationality=== Police announced Kasab was a Pakistani national based on his confession and other evidence.[http://www.timesnow.tv/NewsDtls.aspx%3FNewsID%3D25012&cid=1286214446&usg=AFQjCNE5EoStCK2WBjKPbKpqljRZaDnKgw Enough evidence, now Pak must act: Pranab Mukherjee] {{dead link|date=October 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Several reporters visited Kasab's village and verified the facts provided by him.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/07/mumbai-terrorism-india-pakistan|title=Revealed: home of Mumbai's gunman in Pakistan village, The Observer, 7 December 2008|work=The Guardian|location=London|first=Saeed|last=Shah|date=7 December 2008|accessdate=23 April 2010}}{{cite news|first= Saeed|last=Shah|title=Mumbai terrorist came from Pakistan, local villagers confirm|date=7 December 2008|work=The Observer|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/07/mumbai-terrorism-india-pakistan1|accessdate=7 December 2008| location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081207213956/http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2008/dec/07/mumbai-terrorism-india-pakistan1|archivedate=7 December 2008 | deadurl= no}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dawn.net/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/revealing-the-faridkot-mumbai-link-wk |title=Revealing the Faridkot-Mumbai link, Dawn News special report, 12 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100918222724/http://www.dawn.net/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/revealing-the-faridkot-mumbai-link-wk |archivedate=18 September 2010 }} Former Pakistan Prime Minister, [[Nawaz Sharif]] confirmed that Kasab was from Faridkot village in Pakistan, and criticised President [[Asif Ali Zardari|Zardari]] for cordoning off the village and not allowing his parents to meet anyone.{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/000200812191645.htm|title=Why cordon off Kasab's village? Nawaz Sharif|date=19 December 2008|work=The Hindu|accessdate=19 December 2008|location=Chennai, India|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081223012718/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/000200812191645.htm| archivedate=23 December 2008 |deadurl= no}} Journalist Saeed Shah travelled to Kasab's village and produced [[Identity document#Pakistan|national identity card]] numbers of his parents. His parents left town on the night of 3 December 2008.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/dec/07/mumbai-terrorism-india-pakistan|title=Revealed: home of Mumbai's gunman in Pakistan village|author=Shah, Saeed|work=The Observer|date=7 December 2008|location=London}} Mumbai Joint Police Commissioner of Crime [[Rakesh Maria]] said Kasab was from the Faridkot village in the Okara district of Pakistan's Punjab province, and was the son of Mohammed Amir Kasab.{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/12/03/india.attacks/index.html|title=Kasab is the son of Mohammed Amir Kasab from the Faridkot village in the Okara district of Pakistan|publisher=CNN|accessdate=23 April 2010|date=4 December 2008}} The Mumbai Police said much of the information that Kasab provided proved to be accurate. He disclosed the location of a fishing trawler, MV ''Kuber'', that the terrorists used to enter Mumbai's coastal waters. He told investigators where his team put the ship captain's body, a satellite phone and a [[Global positioning system|global-positioning device]], which the police found.{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB122834446748477265?mod=googlenews_wsj#|title=Sole captured suspect offers grim insights into massacre|work=The Wall Street Journal|first1=Peter |last1=Wonacott|first2=Geeta|last2=Anand|date=4 December 2008}} Pakistani officials, including President [[Asif Ali Zardari]], initially denied Ajmal Kasab was Pakistani.[http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/News/PoliticsNation/Ajmal_Kasab_is_Pakistani_says_Sharif/rssarticleshow/3865125.cms Ajmal Kasab is Pakistani, says Sharif][http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/After-India-Sharif-slams-Zardari-says-Kasab-from-Pak/400494/ After India, Sharif slams Zardari, says Kasab from Pak] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081222065611/http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/After-India-Sharif-slams-Zardari-says-Kasab-from-Pak/400494/ |date=22 December 2008 }} Pakistani government officials attempted to erase evidence that there was a [[Lashkar-e-Taiba]] office in Deepalpur. The office was hurriedly closed in the week of 7 December. On the night of 3 December 2008, the parents were whisked away by a ''bearded Mullah'', and since then, there was evidence of a cover-up by plainclothes police. Villagers changed their stories, and reporters who visit there were intimidated.{{cite web|url=http://www.mcclatchydc.com/world/story/57251.html|title=Pakistani villagers confirm home of Mumbai killer, McClatchy Newspapers, 6 December 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081207141111/http://www.mcclatchydc.com/world/story/57251.html|archivedate=7 December 2008|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/2008/12/08/stories/2008120859411000.htm|title=Revealed: Home of Mumbai gunman in Pakistani village|location=Chennai, India|date=8 December 2008}} In early December, Kasab's father admitted in an interview that Kasab was his son. In January 2009, Pakistan's National Security Advisor [[Mahmud Ali Durrani]] admitted to Kasab being a Pakistani citizen while speaking to the [[CNN-IBN]] news channel. The Pakistan Government then acknowledged that Ajmal Kasab was a Pakistani, but also announced that Prime Minister [[Yousaf Raza Gilani]] had fired Durrani for "failing to take Gilani and other stakeholders into confidence" before making this information public, and for "a lack of coordination on matters of national security."[https://www.nytimes.com/2009/01/08/world/asia/08pstan.html?_r=1 Gunman in Mumbai Siege a Pakistani, Official Says – NYTimes] ==Police interrogation== ===Naming confusion=== On 6 December 2008, ''[[The Hindu]]'' reported that the police officers who interrogated him did not speak his language, [[Urdu language|Urdu]], and misinterpreted his [[caste]] origin "[[Qassab|kasai]]", meaning butcher, to be a surname, writing it as "Kasav".{{cite news|first=Praveen|last=Swami|title=Terrorist's name lost in transliteration|date=6 December 2008|work=[[The Hindu]]|url=http://www.hindu.com/2008/12/06/stories/2008120661211200.htm |accessdate=6 December 2008|location=Chennai, India|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081208090328/http://www.hindu.com/2008/12/06/stories/2008120661211200.htm|archivedate=8 December 2008 |deadurl= no}} ''[[The Times of India]]'' reported a different version of the error. The paper stated that the police officers correctly understood that Ajmal Kasab [[Pakistani name|does not have a surname]]. To satisfy an administrative requirement that people have surnames, the officers asked Kasab for his father's profession, and decided to use "butcher", or "Kasab" in Urdu, as his surname.{{cite news|title=Mumbai cops gave Ajmal his surname|date=7 December 2008|work=[[The Times of India]]| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-07/mumbai/27927339_1_surname-mumbai-cops-kasab|accessdate=7 December 2008}}{{cite news|title=Cops called him 'Kasav' as dad was a butcher|date=7 December 2008|work=[[The Times of India]]| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-07/india/27922614_1_kasav-butcher-terror-attacks| archive-url=https://archive.is/20121123182115/http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-07/india/27922614_1_kasav-butcher-terror-attacks| dead-url=yes| archive-date=23 November 2012|accessdate=7 December 2008}} ''The Hindu'' referred to him as either "Mohammad Ajmal Amir, son of Mohammad Amir Iman" or "Mohammad Ajmal Amir 'Kasab'". List of various names used to refer to Kasab: * ''Ajmal Kasab'' {{cite news|title=Now, arrested terrorist Ajmal says kill me|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/Now_arrested_terrorist_Ajmal_says_kill_me/articleshow/3775413.cms|work=The Times of India|date=30 November 2008}} * ''Azam Amir Kasav''{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/2008/12/02/stories/2008120257410100.htm|title=Mumbai massacre story unfolds in terrorist's interrogation|location=Chennai|work=The Hindu|date=2 December 2008}} * ''Ajmal Qasab''{{cite news|url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/World-News/Mumbai-Terror-Attacks-Sky-News-Gets-Exclusive-Footage-Of-Gun-Suspect-Ajmal-Qasabs-Arrest/Article/200812115168244?lpos=World_News_Top_Stories_Header_0&lid=ARTICLE_15168244_Mumbai_Terror_Attacks%3A_Sky_News_Gets_Exclusive_Footage_Of_Gun_Suspect_Ajmal_Qasabs_Arrest|title=Video of Mumbai Suspect's Arrest|date=1 December 2008|publisher=Sky News|accessdate=2 December 2008| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081202012324/http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/World-News/Mumbai-Terror-Attacks-Sky-News-Gets-Exclusive-Footage-Of-Gun-Suspect-Ajmal-Qasabs-Arrest/Article/200812115168244?lpos=World_News_Top_Stories_Header_0&lid=ARTICLE_15168244_Mumbai_Terror_Attacks%3A_Sky_News_Gets_Exclusive_Footage_Of_Gun_Suspect_Ajmal_Qasabs_Arrest| archivedate= 2 December 2008}} * ''Ajmal Amir Kamal''{{cite news|title=Three Lashkar fidayeen captured|date=29 November 2008|work=The Hindu|url=http://www.hindu.com/2008/11/28/stories/2008112862080100.htm|location=Chennai, India}} * ''Ajmal Amir Kasab''{{cite news|title=Arrested terrorist says gang hoped to get away|date=29 November 2008|publisher=Economic Times, India| url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/News/PoliticsNation/Arrested_terrorist_says_gang_hoped_to_get_away/articleshow/msid-3772281,curpg-1.cms}} * ''Azam Ameer Qasab''{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/we-trained-in-lashkar-camps-arrested-terrorist/392088/|title=Indian Express: we trained in Lashkar camps, arrested terrorist}} * ''Mohammad Ajmal Qasam''{{cite web|url=http://www.bi-me.com/main.php?id=28080&t=1&c=33&cg=4&mset=|title=Business Intelligence Middle East}} * ''Ajmal Mohammed Amir Kasab''{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-11-29/india/27908043_1_terrorists-hostage-drama-cama-hospital|title=Times of India: 10 terrorists have entered Mumbai|work=The Times of India|first1=Mateen|last1=Hafeez|date=29 November 2008}} * ''Mohammad Ajmal Amir Kasar''{{cite web|url=http://www.gulfnews.com/world/India/10263664.html|title=Gulf News: Lone surviving gunman reveals operation details|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081202081203/http://www.gulfnews.com/world/India/10263664.html|archivedate=2 December 2008|df=dmy-all}} * ''Amjad Amir Kamaal''{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/2008/12/01/stories/2008120157370100.htm|title=The Hindu: Pakistan now holds the key to probe: investigators|location=Chennai|date=1 December 2008}} * ''Mohammed Ajmal Amir Qasab''{{cite news|publisher=BBC News|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/south_asia/7796381.stm|title=Gunman 'requests Pakistan help'|date=22 December 2008 | accessdate=1 January 2010}}{{cite news|work=The Times|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/article5339635.ece|title=British police to interview Mumbai suspect Mohammed Ajmal Amir Qasab|date=15 December 2008|author=Sam Coates and Jeremy Page|location=London}} ===Confessions=== [[Ammunition]], a [[satellite phone]] and a layout plan of [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus]] was recovered from Kasab. He described how his team arrived at Mumbai from [[Karachi]] via [[Porbandar]]. He said that they had received [[revolver]]s, [[AK-47]]s, [[Magazine (firearms)|ammunition]] and [[dried fruit]] from their coordinator.{{cite news|title=Please give me saline |date=29 November 2008 |work=Bangalore Mirror |url=http://www.bangaloremirror.com/index.aspx?page=article§id=1&contentid=2008112920081129095627277cedee9e0§xslt= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090302112856/http://www.bangaloremirror.com/index.aspx?page=article§id=1&contentid=2008112920081129095627277cedee9e0§xslt= |archivedate=2 March 2009 }} Kasab told the police that they wanted to replicate the [[Islamabad Marriott Hotel bombing|Marriott hotel attack]] in [[Islamabad]], and reduce the Taj Hotel to rubble, replicating the [[11 September attacks]] in US. Kasab told police that his team targeted Nariman House, where the Chabad centre was located, because it was frequented by Israelis, who were targeted to "avenge atrocities on Palestinians."[http://jta.org/news/article/2008/11/30/1001254/terrorist-we-were-sent-to-target-israelis Terrorist: We were sent to target Israelis], Jewish Telegraph Agency (JTA),30 November 2008.{{cite news|url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1227702365053&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull|title=Terrorists at Chabad House 'deliberately targeted' Jewish building|work=The Jerusalem Post|date=30 November 2008|accessdate=30 November 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120204003546/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1227702365053&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull|archivedate=4 February 2012|df=dmy-all}}{{cite book|last=Rubenstein|first=Richard L.|title=Jihad and Genocide|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=UyNR4AAevwIC&pg=PA181|accessdate=8 January 2012|date=16 May 2011|publisher=Rowman & Littlefield|isbn=978-0-7425-6203-5|pages=181–182}} Kasab told the police that he and his associate, Ismail Khan, were the ones who shot Anti-Terror Squad chief [[Hemant Karkare]], encounter specialist [[Vijay Salaskar]] and Additional Commissioner [[Ashok Kamte]]. Kasab entered the Taj posing as a student from [[Mauritius]] and stored explosives in one of the hotel's rooms.{{cite news |url=http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/mumbaiterrorstrike/Election_Story.aspx?ID=NEWEN20080074564&type=News |title=Arrested terrorist reveals all to police |date=29 November 2008 |publisher=[[NDTV]] |accessdate=29 November 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081202052125/http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/mumbaiterrorstrike/Election_Story.aspx?ID=NEWEN20080074564&type=News |archivedate=2 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} In December 2009, Kasab retracted his confession in court, claiming he had come to Mumbai to act in Bollywood films and was arrested by the Mumbai police three days before the attacks.[http://www.bangaloremirror.com/index.aspx?Page=article§name=News%20-%20Nation§id=11&contentid=2009121820091218194801146c94e0a2a Ajab Kasab ki ghazab kahani, Banglore Mirror, 18 December 2009] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120331232957/http://www.bangaloremirror.com/index.aspx?Page=article§name=News%20-%20Nation§id=11&contentid=2009121820091218194801146c94e0a2a |date=31 March 2012 }} ====Confessions on video==== Kasab repeatedly asked the interrogators to turn the camera off and warned them he would not speak otherwise. Nonetheless the following confessions were recorded on video:[https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=The+Kasab+Confession+ The Kasab Confession, Newsxlive, Nov 26, 2009] When police asked Kasab what he understood about jihad, Kasab told the interrogators "it [[Jihad]] is about killing and getting killed and becoming famous." "Come, kill and die after a killing spree. By this one will become famous and will also make God proud."{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Blotter/Story?id=6385015&page=2|title=Mumbai Terrorist Wanted to Kill and Die and Become Famous, ABC News, 3 December 2008}} According to an officer, Kasab spoke Pathani Hindi, and told the police that he threw up the moment he saw all the blood and gore. "Kasab said that he could not bear the sight of dead bodies and after creating enough havoc wanted to go back to Pakistan," the officer said.{{Citation needed|date=December 2008}} "We were told that our big brother India is so rich and we are dying of poverty and hunger. My father sells [[dahi vada|dahi wada]] in a stall in Lahore and we did not even get enough food to eat from his earnings. I was promised that once they knew that I was successful in my operation, they would give 150,000 rupees (around US$3,352), to my family," said Kasab. Police said they were shocked by his readiness to switch loyalties after he was apprehended. "If you give me regular meals and money I will do the same for you that I did for them," he said. "When we asked whether he knew any verses from the Quran that described jihad, Kasab said he did not," police said. "In fact he did not know much about Islam or its tenets," according to a police source. ===Face to face with Abu Jundal=== On 9 August 2012, Kasab was brought face-to-face with [[Zabiuddin Ansari|Abu Jundal]], the handler of Mumbai attacks, at the Arthur Road jail where they identified each other. Kasab also admitted that Jundal had taught him Hindi.{{cite web|url= http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Kasab-identifies-Jundal-as-26-11-handler/Article1-911122.aspx|title= Kasab identifies Jundal as 26/11 handler|date= 10 August 2012|accessdate= 27 November 2012|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20120813035158/http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Kasab-identifies-Jundal-as-26-11-handler/Article1-911122.aspx|archivedate= 13 August 2012|df= dmy-all}} ===Other reports=== In a press conference, the Mumbai city police commissioner said "The person we have caught alive is certainly a Pakistani. They were all trained by ex-army officers, some for a year, some for more than a year".{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/12/02/AR2008120202968.html|title=Washington Post—Indian Investigators reveal details culled from arrested gunman. Retrieved 3 December 2008|work=The Washington Post|first=Rama| last=Lakshmi|date=3 December 2008|accessdate=23 April 2010}} On 23 November 2008 they set sail from Karachi unarmed to be picked up by a larger vessel. They hijacked the Indian fishing trawler ''Kuber'' and set sail for Mumbai. ''[[The Times]]'' reported on 3 December 2008 that Indian police were going to submit Kasab to a [[narco analysis]] test to definitively determine his nationality. According to ''[[Daily News and Analysis|DNA India]]'', Kasab began reading [[The Story of My Experiments with Truth|the autobiography]] of India's non-violent leader [[Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi]] in early March 2009, in response to coaxing by prison guards.{{cite news|first=Nikhil|last=Dixit|title=Ajmal is Reading Gandhi in Jail|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/report.asp?newsid=1239725|publisher=DNA (Daily News and Analysis)|date=17 March 2009|accessdate=17 March 2009}} ==Legal issues== Several Indian lawyers refused to represent Kasab citing ethical concerns. A resolution was passed unanimously by the Bombay Metropolitan Magistrate Court's Bar Association, which has more than 1,000 members, saying that none of its members would defend any of the accused of the terror attacks.[[Press Trust of India]] (6 December 2008) [http://www.rediff.com/news/2008/dec/06mumterror-lawyers-refuse-to-defend-kasab.htm Lawyers refuse to take up arrested terrorist's case] [[Rediff.com]]. Retrieved 25 November 2012. Other bar associations passed similar resolutions. The Hindu nationalist group [[Shiv Sena]] threatened lawyers against representing him. When one attorney, Ashok Sarogi, hinted that he would be willing to represent Kasab, Shiv Shena members protested outside his home and pelted it with stones, forcing him to retract.[http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shiv-sena-forces-lawyer-to-back-out-of-kasab-case/80619-3.html?from=search-relatedstories Sena forces lawyer to back out of Kasab case]. CNN-IBN.in.com. Retrieved 17 August 2013.[http://zeenews.india.com/Nation/2008-12-17/491850news.html Ajmal Amir Kasab should get lawyer for "fair trial", says Chief Justice of India] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131229174413/http://zeenews.india.com/Nation/2008-12-17/491850news.html |date=29 December 2013 }}. Zeenews.india.com. Retrieved 17 August 2013. In December 2008, the [[Chief Justice of India|Indian Chief Justice]] [[K. G. Balakrishnan]] said that for a fair trial, Kasab needed a lawyer.[http://www.zeenews.com/Nation/2008-12-17/491850news.html Kasab should get lawyer for fair trial] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081219064532/http://www.zeenews.com/Nation/2008-12-17/491850news.html |date=19 December 2008 }} ''[[Zee News]]''. 17 December 2008 (New Delhi). Retrieved 25 November 2012. An eight-member commission from Pakistan, comprising defence lawyers, prosecutors and a court official was allowed to travel to India on 15 March to gather evidences for the prosecution of seven suspects linked to the 2008 Mumbai attacks. However, the defence lawyers were barred from cross-examining the four prosecution witnesses in the case including Ajmal Kasab.http://tribune.com.pk/story/371467/2008-mumbai-attacks-indias-refusal-to-allow-cross-examination-challenged/http://nation.com.pk/national/14-Mar-2015/pakistan-india-trade-demarches-over-lakhvi-trial Kasab wrote to the Pakistani High Commission in India requesting help and legal aid. In the letter, he confirmed he and the nine slain terrorists were Pakistani.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7796381.stm Gunman 'requests Pakistan help'] [[BBC]]. 22 December 2008. Retrieved 25 November 2012. He asked the Pakistani High Commission to take custody of the body of fellow terrorist Ismail Khan.[http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-12-22/india/27913486_1_mumbai-attacks-india-hands-india-shahid-malik India hands Kasab's letter to Pak high commission] ''[[The Times of India]]''. 22 December 2008. Retrieved 25 November 2012.{{Dead link|date=October 2016}} Pakistani officials confirmed the receipt of the letter and were reported to be studying it. No further updates were given. On 1 April 2009, Senior Advocate Anjali Waghmare agreed to represent Kasab, despite [[Shiv Sena]] activists having protested and stoned her home.[http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-04-01/india/28017971_1_anjali-waghmare-m-l-tahiliyani-k-p-pawar I will represent Kasab: Anjali Waghmare – Times Of India]. ''The Times of India''. (1 April 2009). Retrieved 17 August 2013. ==Trial== His conviction was based on CCTV footage showing him striding across the [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus]] with an [[AK-47]] and a backpack. Towards the end of December 2008, Ujjwal Nikam was appointed as Public Prosecutor for trying Kasab and in January 2009 [[M.L. Tahaliyani]] was appointed the judge for the case.[http://news.outlookindia.com/item.aspx?663002 Mumbai Attacks: A Chronology of the Trial] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110718083520/http://news.outlookindia.com/item.aspx?663002 |date=18 July 2011 }} [[Outlook (magazine)|Outlook India]]. 20 July 2009. Retrieved 25 November 2012. Indian investigators filed an 11,000-page [[Chargesheet]] against Kasab on 25 February 2009.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/26/world/asia/26mumbai.html|title=Pakistani charged in Mumbai assault|date=26 February 2009|work=The New York Times|last=Kumar|first=Hari}} Due to the fact that the chargesheet was written in [[Marathi language|Marathi]] and English, Kasab requested an Urdu translation of the charge sheet.{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-03-10/india/28001495_1_mohammad-ajmal-amir-kasab-arthur-road-jail-ujjwal-nikam | work=The Times of India|title=26/11 trial: Kasab seeks translated copy of chargesheet|date=10 March 2009}} He was charged with murder, conspiracy and waging war against India along with other crimes. His trial was originally scheduled to start on 15 April 2009 but was postponed as his lawyer, Anjali Waghmare was dismissed for a conflict of interest.{{cite news|url=http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/story.aspx?id=NEWEN20090090863|title=Anjali Waghmare removed as Qasab's lawyer|date=15 April 2009|publisher=NDTV|accessdate=15 April 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090417000345/http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/story.aspx?id=NEWEN20090090863|archivedate=17 April 2009|df=dmy-all}} It resumed on 17 April 2009 after [[Abbas Kazmi]] was assigned as his new defence counsel.[http://www.hindu.com/2009/04/17/stories/2009041760571300.htm The Hindu Ajmal Kasab gets a new lawyer] On 20 April 2009, the prosecution submitted a list of charges against him, including the murder of 166 people. On 6 May 2009, Kasab pleaded not guilty to 86 charges.{{cite news |title=Mumbai suspect denies all charges|publisher=BBC|date=6 May 2009|url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8035809.stm |accessdate=6 May 2009|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090509061831/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8035809.stm| archivedate=9 May 2009 |deadurl= no}} The same month he was identified by eyewitnesses who testified witnessing his actual arrival and him firing at the victims. Later the doctors who treated him also identified him. On 2 June 2009, Kasab told the judge he also understood the [[Marathi language]]. In June 2009, the special court issued non-bailable warrants against 22 absconding accused including Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD) chief Hafeez Saeed and chief of operations of Lashkar-e-Taiba, Zaki-ur-Rehman Laqvi. On 20 July 2009 Kasab retracted his non-guilty plea and pleaded guilty to all charges.{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/kasab-confesses-to-role-in-26-11-terror-attacks/491739 |title=I confess... please end my trial, deliver your judgment|work=The Indian Express |date=20 July 2009 |accessdate=16 September 2011}} On 18 December 2009, he retracted his guilty plea and claimed that he was framed and his confession was obtained by torture. Instead he claimed to have come to Mumbai 20 days before the attacks and was simply strolling at Juhu beach when police arrested him.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/south_asia/8419996.stm Mumbai accused says he was framed – BBC] The trial concluded on 31 March 2010 and on 3 May the verdict was pronounced – Kasab was found guilty of murder, conspiracy, and of waging war against India (which also carried the death penalty).{{cite news|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hfCYOKxkJou-hpK6D9bq_8zIZ9hAD9FFAI500 |title=Indian court convicts Pakistani for Mumbai siege |agency=Associated Press |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100508215142/https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hfCYOKxkJou-hpK6D9bq_8zIZ9hAD9FFAI500 |archivedate=8 May 2010 }} On 6 May 2010, he was sentenced to death.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8664179.stm|title= Mumbai attack gunman Kasab sentenced to death|date=6 May 2010|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=7 May 2010|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100508141053/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8664179.stm|archivedate=8 May 2010|deadurl= no}} A [[Bombay High Court]] bench, composed of Justice Ranjanaa Desai and Justice Ranjit More, heard Kasab's appeal against the death penalty and upheld the sentence given by the trial court in their verdict on 21 February 2011.{{cite news|title=26/11: Bombay HC confirms Kasab's death sentence|work=The Indian Express|date=21 February 2011|url= http://www.indianexpress.com/news/26-11-bombay-hc-confirms-kasabs-death-sentence/752675/|accessdate=21 February 2011}} On 30 July 2011, Kasab moved to [[Supreme Court of India]], challenging his conviction and sentence in the case.{{Cite journal|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-07-30/india/29832746_1_ajmal-kasab-trial-court-cama-hospital|title=Kasab moves SC against death penalty|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=30 July 2011|accessdate=1 August 2011|ref=harv|postscript={{inconsistent citations}}}} Thus, a bench composed of Justice Aftab Alam and Justice Chandramouli Kr. Prasad stayed the orders of the Bombay High Court so as to follow the due process of law, and started hearing the case. On 29 August 2012, Kasab was found guilty of waging war and was sentenced to death by the Supreme Court of India.{{cite web|url=http://supremecourtofindia.nic.in/outtoday/39511.pdf|title=CRIMINAL APPEAL NOS.1899–1900 OF 2011|date=29 August 2012|publisher=[[Supreme Court of India]]|accessdate=6 February 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130118063713/http://supremecourtofindia.nic.in/outtoday/39511.pdf|archivedate=18 January 2013|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|title=Ajmal Kasab loses appeal, Supreme Court upholds death sentence|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/NewDelhi/Ajmal-Kasab-loses-appeal-Supreme-Court-upholds-death-sentence/Article1-920850.aspx|accessdate=29 August 2012|newspaper=[[Hindustan Times]]|date=28 August 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120831231736/http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/NewDelhi/Ajmal-Kasab-loses-appeal-Supreme-Court-upholds-death-sentence/Article1-920850.aspx|archivedate=31 August 2012|df=dmy-all}} ==Execution== Kasab's plea for [[clemency]] was rejected by President [[Pranab Mukherjee]] on 5 November 2012.{{cite web|title=Ajmal Amir Kasab hanged|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/video/national/6/ajmal-amir-kasab-hanged-----/13626|work=The Indian Express|accessdate=21 November 2012}} On 7 November, [[Minister of Home Affairs (India)|Minister of Home Affairs]] [[Sushilkumar Shinde]] confirmed the President's rejection of the petition. The following day, the Maharashtra state government was formally notified and requested to take action. The date of 21 November was then fixed for the execution, and the Indian government faxed their decision to the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Pakistan)|Pakistani Foreign Office]]. Everything so far on secret basis, Kasab was formally informed of his execution on 12 November, after which he requested government officials to inform his mother. On the night of 18–19 November, a senior prison official at Arthur Road Jail in Mumbai read Kasab's death warrant to him, informing him at the same time that his petition for clemency had been rejected. Kasab was then asked to sign his death warrant, which he did. He was secretly transferred under heavy guard to [[Yerwada Jail]] in [[Pune]], arriving in the early morning of 19 November. The death and funeral of nationalist politician [[Bal Thackeray]] also aided in diverting attention from Kasab.{{cite news|title=I swear by God, won't do such a thing again, uttered Kasab before his execution|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Last-words-Dobara-aisi-galti-nahi-karunga/Article1-962444.aspx|newspaper=Hindustan Times|date=21 November 2012|accessdate=26 November 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121127172052/http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Last-words-Dobara-aisi-galti-nahi-karunga/Article1-962444.aspx|archivedate=27 November 2012|df=dmy-all}} An officer at Arthur Road Jail stated anonymously: "Throughout the journey from Mumbai to Pune, he did not cause any trouble. Kasab's attitude was of resignation when he came to know that his mercy petition was rejected by the president. Kasab did not shed a single tear during the last few days." Only the jail superintendent at Yerwada was made aware of Kasab's identity. Kasab was placed in a special cell when he was at Yerwada and no other inmates were informed of his presence. It was only a few minutes before Kasab's execution that the executioner was informed whom he would be hanging.{{cite news|title=Hangman gets last-minute surprise|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/hangman-gets-last-minute-surprise/article1-962259.aspx|newspaper=Hindustan Times|date=22 November 2012}} {{quote box|width=20em|bgcolor=#c6dbf7|align=right|quote=The punishment to Kasab is a true tribute to the victims and martyrs of the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks.|source=—Maharashtra Home Minister [[R. R. Patil]]}} Though reportedly nervous in the final minutes before his execution, Kasab remained quiet and offered prayers. He was hanged on 21 November 2012 at 7:30, according to an announcement by Home Minister Shinde.{{cite news|title=Ajmal Kasab hanged and buried in Pune's Yerwada Jail|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-11-21/india/35256891_1_ajmal-kasab-mercy-petition-mumbai-terror|accessdate=21 November 2012|newspaper=The Times of India|date=21 November 2012}}{{cite news|title=Ajmal Kasab hanged|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/states/other-states/ajmal-kasab-hanged/article4118491.ece|accessdate=21 November 2012|newspaper=The Hindu|date=21 November 2012}} Kasab's execution by the Maharashtra government happened barely two weeks after President Pranab Mukherjee rejected his mercy petition on 5 November."{{cite news|last=Kumar|first=Devesh|title=Ajmal Kasab hanged, buried at Pune's Yerwada Jail|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/ajmal-kasab-hanged-after-president-rejected-his-mercy-plea/1/230103.html|accessdate=21 November 2012|newspaper=India Today|date=21 November 2012}} After the government contemplated burial at sea, the decision was finally made to bury Kasab at Yerwada Jail.{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/india/live-laskar-e-taiba-says-kasab-a-hero-will-inspire-more-attacks-529858.html|title=Live: Is India going too far in celebrating Kasab's hanging?|publisher=Firstpost|accessdate=21 November 2012}} Following his execution, Kasab's body was given to a [[maulvi]] for burial in accordance with Islamic rites.{{cite news|title=No one in Yerawada knew who was to hang|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_no-one-in-yerawada-knew-who-was-to-hang_1767889|newspaper=Daily News and Analysis|date=22 November 2012}} [[Ansar Burney]], a human rights activist in Pakistan, later offered to help repatriate Kasab's body to Pakistan citing humanitarian reasons.{{cite news|title=Ansar Burney offers help to bring Kasab's body to Pakistan|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report_ansar-burney-offers-help-to-bring-kasab-s-body-to-pakista_1767542|date=21 November 2012|work=[[Daily News and Analysis]]|accessdate=21 November 2012}}{{cite news|title=Ready to bring home Kasab's body: Pak rights activist|url=http://www.rediff.com/news/report/ready-to-bring-home-kasabs-body-pakistan-human-rights-activist/20121121.htm|date=21 November 2012|agency=[[Rediff|Rediff News]]|accessdate=21 November 2012}} The Indian government stated it would consider a formal application if offered.{{cite web|publisher=Firstpost.com|title=After Kasab, we hope Pak will apply rule of law to other 26/11 accused|url=http://www.firstpost.com/india/after-kasab-we-hope-pak-will-apply-rule-of-law-to-other-2611-accused-530018.html|accessdate=22 November 2012}} Shinde later stated that Kasab's body was buried in India because Pakistan had refused to claim it.{{cite news|title=Kasab's body will be laid to rest in India as Pak refused to claim it, says Sushil Kumar Shinde|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/kasabs-body-will-be-laid-to-rest-in-india-as-pak-refused-to-claim-it-says-sushil-kumar-shinde/306566-3.html|date=21 November 2012|publisher=CNN-IBN|location=New Delhi|accessdate=21 November 2012}} ===Reaction=== Authorities in [[Uttar Pradesh]] banned all celebrations and public gatherings and placed the state on high alert in response.{{cite news|title=UP bans celebration of Ajmal Kasab hanging|url= http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-11-22/noida/35301329_1_ajmal-kasab-police-officers-celebration|newspaper=The Times of India|date=22 November 2012}} Similarly, the [[Tamil Nadu Police|Coimbatore City Police]] took a group of people in [[Coimbatore]] into preventive custody for celebrating Kasab's execution.{{cite news|title=Police spoil plan to party over Kasab hanging|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-11-22/coimbatore/35301835_1_ajmal-kasab-mumbai-terror-attack-police-action|date=22 November 2012|work=[[The Times of India]]|location=Coimbatore|accessdate=23 November 2012}} K. Unnikrishnan, father of Major [[Sandeep Unnikrishnan]], said though the execution was necessary, it was not something to "rejoice over" and that the ensuing celebrations were "foolishness."{{cite news|title=Sandeep's father: Execution is not a matter to rejoice over|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/sandeeps-father-execution-is-not-a-matter-to-rejoice-over/article4120251.ece|newspaper=The Hindu|date=22 November 2012}} In Pakistan, the general and official government response was muted, with the media treating the execution as another news item, according to ''[[The Hindu]]''.{{cite news|title=Pakistan quietly absorbs news of execution|url=http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/pakistan-quietly-absorbs-news-of-execution/article4121591.ece|newspaper=The Hindu|date=22 November 2012}} Though some journalists attempted to elicit statements from villagers in Kasab's village of Faridkot, they met with a hostile response. A senior LeT commander issued an anonymous statement, saying Kasab was a hero who would "inspire more fighters to follow his path." The [[Pakistani Taliban]]'s spokesman Ehsanullah Ehsan issued a statement threatening Indians with retaliation and declaring Kasab would be avenged. Ehsan also made demands for Kasab's body to be returned to his family. "If they don't return his body to us or his family we will capture Indians and will not return their bodies."{{cite news|title=Pakistan Taliban vow to attack Indian targets over Kasab|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/Pakistan-Taliban-vow-to-attack-Indian-targets-over-Kasab/articleshow/17319932.cms|newspaper=The Times of India|date=22 November 2012}} While commending on the well appreciated role of two women officers in the smooth handling of the execution, Patil later responded to threats to avenge Kasab's death by stating that anybody daring to attack the soil of Maharashtra would meet the same fate.{{cite news|title=Maharashtra jail staff to get pay parity with police department |url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/cities/maharashtra-jail-staff-to-get-pay-parity-with-police-department-296711|date=24 November 2012|agency=[[Press Trust of India]]|location=Pune|publisher=[[NDTV]]|accessdate=24 November 2012}} [[Hafiz Muhammad Saeed|Hafiz Saeed]] and thousands of others offered ''ghayabana namaz-e-janaza'' (funeral prayers in absentia) for Kasab at a [[Jamaat-ud-Dawah]] session in [[Muridke]].{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/2611-mastermind-hafiz-saeed-offers-funeral-prayers-for-ajmal-kasab/1035782|title=26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed offers funeral prayers for Ajmal Kasab|date=24 November 2012|work=[[The Indian Express]]|accessdate=28 November 2012|quote=LeT founder Hafiz Mohammad Saeed led a gathering of thousands in offering funeral prayers for Ajmal Kasab, the lone surviving terrorist involved in the Mumbai attacks who was hanged earlier this week, a media report said today.}} Hundreds of others in [[Srinagar]] also offered similar prayers at the appeal of [[Syed Ali Shah Geelani|Syed Ali Geelani]].{{cite web|url=http://kashmirwatch.com/news.php/2012/11/23/funeral-prayer-held-for-kasab-in-valley.html|title=In-depth Coverage on Kashmir Conflict|date=23 November 2012|publisher=Kashmir Watch|accessdate=28 November 2012|quote=Srinagar: Hundreds of people today offered funeral-in-absentia or ‘gaibana nimaz-e-jinaza’ for Mumbai terror attack convict Ajmal Kasab who was hanged in Pune’s Yerwada Jail on Wednesday. Hardline separatist leader Syed Ali Geelani had appealed to people to hold his funeral prayers. Kasab’s funeral was offered today afternoon at the city’s Barzulla area.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130719103520/http://kashmirwatch.com/news.php/2012/11/23/funeral-prayer-held-for-kasab-in-valley.html|archivedate=19 July 2013|df=dmy-all}} ===Pakistan Anti-Terrorism Court (ATC) Proceedings=== Mudassir Lakhvi, headmaster of the Government Elementary School in Faridkot village, Okara, appeared before the Anti-Terrorism Court (ATC) on 9 May 2014, during the trial of seven suspects, (Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi, Abdul Wajid, Mazhar Iqbal, Hammad Amin Sadiq, Shahid Jameel Riaz, Jamil Ahmed and Younus Anjum), accused of involvement in the attacks on 26 November 2008.[http://www.dawn.com/news/1105177/witness-in-mumbai-attacks-case-claims-ajmal-kasab-is-alive Witness in Mumbai attacks case claims Ajmal Kasab is alive, Malik Asad, Dawn, May 10, 2014] He claimed that Ajmal Kasab he knew is alive, and he had met Ajmal only a few days ago. He repeated the claim in 2015.[http://tribune.com.pk/story/1008065/ajmal-kasab-is-alive-claims-key-witness/ Ajmal Kasab is alive, claims key witness, Express tribune, December 11, 2015] ==See also== * [[David Headley]] * [[Terrorism in India]] ==Citations== {{Reflist|30em|refs = *The [[government of Pakistan]] initially denied that Kasab was a Pakistani citizen, but, in January 2009, it confirmed his citizenship. {{cite news|url=http://archives.dawn.com/archives/42931|title=Ajmal's Nationality Confirmed |publisher=Dawn (Pakistani Newspaper) |date=8 January 2009|accessdate=31 January 2012}} *{{cite news | url=http://www.thehindu.com/opinion/op-ed/ticket-to-paradise-in-a-brutal-world/article4120451.ece | title=Ticket to paradise in a brutal world | date=22 November 2012 | accessdate=22 November 2012}} }} ==References== {{refbegin}} * {{Cite book |year=2010 |last=Rommel Rodrigues |first= |title=[[Kasab: The Face of 26/11]] |publisher= Penguin Books India |location=India |isbn=978-01-4341-547-3 |ref= |postscript=}}. {{refend}} {{refbegin}} * {{Cite book |year=2009 |last=Baweja |first=Harinder |title=26/11: Mumbai attacked |publisher= Roli Books |location=Mumbai, India |isbn=978-81-7436-707-5 |ref=harv |postscript=}}. {{refend}} {{2008 Mumbai attacks}} {{PakistanTerrorism}} {{Portal bar|Biography|Mumbai|Pakistan|Punjab|Terrorism}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kasab, Ajmal}} [[Category:1987 births]] [[Category:2012 deaths]] [[Category:21st-century criminals]] [[Category:21st-century executions by India]] [[Category:Lashkar-e-Taiba members]]
