revision.comment: Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contribs/41.147.175.163|41.147.175.163]] to version by InternetArchiveBot. [[WP:CBFP|Report False Positive?]] Thanks, [[WP:CBNG|ClueBot NG]]. (3480223) (Bot)
revision.text:
A '''scam letter''' is a document, distributed electronically or otherwise, to a recipient misrepresenting the truth with the aim of gaining an advantage in a [[fraudulent]] manner.
==Origin== Currently it is unclear how far back the origin of scam letters date. The oldest reference to the origin of scam letters could be found at the [[Spanish Prisoner]] scam.<ref>[http://home.austin.rr.com/tsote/scams/various.html Scams that Keep Being Used on People] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070911140128/http://home.austin.rr.com/tsote/scams/various.html |date=2007-09-11 }}</ref> This scam dates back to the 1580s, where the fictitious prisoner would promise to share non-existent treasure with the person who would send him money to bribe the guards.
Today scam letters are a general part of electronic life, ending up in mailboxes in hordes.
==Types==
===Lottery scam letter=== Based on mostly the same principles as the Nigerian 419 [[advance-fee fraud]] scam, this scam letter informs recipients that their e-mail addresses have been drawn in online lotteries and that they have won large sums of money. Here the victims will also be required to pay substantial small amounts of money in order to have the winning money released, which never materializes.
===Phishing scam letter=== [[Phishing]] scam letters, in short, are a notification from an online 'financial institution', requiring its clients to log into their accounts and verify or change their log-in details. A fraudulent website is set up by offenders, which appears to be the website of the actual financial institution. Once a victim follows the log-in link from the scam letter and logs into the 'account', the log-in details are sent to the offenders.
===Cheap Viagra and software product scam letter=== This is yet another [[scam]] where the [[misrepresentation]] is made as an offer for cheap medical products and computer software. Often, when ordered, victims will not receive the goods or in certain instances a [[counterfeit|fake]] version of the goods ordered.
===Dating love scam letter=== Often users will find the letter from a young and attractive female wanting to meet or relocate to the users' country. After invoking their [[confidence trick]] on the user they will require the recipient of the scam letter to pay the funds necessary for the relocation. Once paid, the correspondence ends and the writer never appears.
===Subscription scam=== Users of some Web sites are sometimes faced with invoices from Internet sites which they have visited. One company with a reputation for this is the Swiss-German based company [[Media Intense]] GmBH, which runs win-load.net.<ref>http://antiabzockenet.blogspot.com/2008/12/media-intense-gmbh.html</ref> Users are asked to create an account before downloading a piece of software. The terms and conditions state that the account requires a subscription of 8 euros per month for a minimum of 24 months, but that the user forfeits the right to cancel. The user will then receive threatening invoices from the company.<ref>http://74.125.43.132/translate_c?hl=en&sl=de&u=http://lawblog.mcneubert.de/2009/03/12/abofallen-katja-gunther-beantragt-mahnbescheide-fur-online-content-ltd/&prev=/search%3Fq%3D%2522media%2Bintense%2Bgmbh%2522%26hl%3Den%26client%3Dsafari%26rls%3Den-us&usg=ALkJrhgtNrK1QdbJT23DqcJ5aN9QD31qLQ</ref><ref>http://www.kuendigung-blog.de/?p=61</ref><ref>http://forum.computerbetrug.de/allgemeines/55652-win-loads-net.html</ref>
Today there exist many forms of scam letters distributed on the Internet. The mentioned examples above acs as an indication of how these scam letters work and how victims are defrauded.
==Distribution==
===Postal services=== In the past, before the introduction of electronic communications, scam letters were posted by normal postal services, which had been a slow and tedious method of defrauding victims. Although this method tremendously decreased its appearance today, it still occurs that a victim might receive the posted scam letter.
===Fax=== Faxed scam letters are in no way an uncommon occurrence.<ref>[http://home.rica.net/alphae/419coal/ The Nigerian Scam Defined]</ref> Today many scam letters are still faxed to corporate institutions, although they are not a large amount due to cost restraints on behalf of offenders.
===Electronic mail=== E-mail is today the prevalent way in which scam letters are distributed. Due to its cost-effectiveness and international reach, offenders prefer this method as victims are reached in a much more timely manner.
===Forums and chat rooms=== Often offenders will target busy Internet-based forums and chat rooms where they will circulate their scam letters to registered users.
==Law enforcement== Generally, law enforcement agencies from around the world are interested in scam letters where actual losses incurred upon a victim. Due to the sheer volume of scam letters distributed on the Internet, no law enforcement agency will be in a position to investigate every scam letter reported.
Most law enforcement agencies, however, introduced a method of reporting scam letters to them. Information on reporting scam letter to them can be found at [http://home.rica.net/alphae/419coal/ The Nigerian Scam Defined].
During August 2007, a new private initiative, [http://www.scamletters.com ScamLetters.com], was launched with the aim of assisting law enforcement agencies by relieving the burden of scam letter reports, as well as assisting in scam letter investigations by availing a unique database for reporting of scam letters by the public.
===Penalty=== Edna Fiedler, 44, of [[Olympia, Washington]], on June 25, 2008, pleaded guilty in a [[Tacoma, Washington|Tacoma]] court and was sentenced to two years imprisonment and five years of supervised release or [[probation]] in an Internet $1 million "Nigerian check scam". She conspired to commit bank, wire and mail fraud against US citizens, specifically using Internet by having an [[accomplice]] ship counterfeit checks and money orders to her from [[Lagos]], Nigeria in November 2007. Fiedler shipped out $609,000 fake check and money orders when arrested and prepared to send additional $1.1 million counterfeit materials. Also, the U.S. Postal Service intercepted $2.1 billion in counterfeit checks, lottery tickets and eBay overpayment schemes with a face value of $2.1 billion.<ref>[http://www.upi.com/Top_News/2008/06/26/Woman_gets_prison_for_Nigerian_scam/UPI-73791214521169/ upi.com, Woman gets prison for 'Nigerian' scam]</ref><ref>[https://tech.yahoo.com/news/pcworld/147575 yahoo.com, Woman Gets Two Years for Aiding Nigerian Internet Check Scam (PC World)]</ref>
==See also== * [[Fraud]] * [[Confidence tricks]] * [[Phishing]] * [[Spanish Prisoner]] * [[Economic and Financial Crimes Commission]] (EFCC), the Nigerian financial authority mandated to investigate against advance fee frauds * [[PhoneBusters]], a Canadian law enforcement project combatting advance fee fraud * [[Nigerian organized crime]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.baiterbase.co.uk Baiterbase scam email database, live] * [http://www.thescambaiter.com/forum/f78/ Alternative live source of scam emails from Baiterbase] * [http://www.nigerian419fraud.com/forumdisplay.php?f=1 Nigerian 419 Fraud Scam Letter Database] * [http://www.NextWebSecurity.com .NExT Web Security: Reporting Scam Letters & Searchable Scam Letter Database] * [http://www.nextwebsecurity.com/419LifeCycle.asp 419 Nigerian Advanced Fee Fraud - Scam Lifecycle (© .NExT Web Security)] * [http://home.rica.net/alphae/419coal/index.htm Nigeria - The 419 Coalition Website] * [https://www.recol.ca/linkspage.aspx Reporting Economic Crime On-Line (RECOL)] [[Canada]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Scam Letters}} [[Category:Fraud]]

revision.comment: /* Synopsis */
revision.text:
{{Infobox play | name = Six Degrees of Separation | image = SixDegreesPoster.jpg | image_size = 180px | caption = Original poster by [[James McMullan]] | writer = [[John Guare]] | characters = | setting = [[New York City]] | premiere = 1990 | place = [[Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts|Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater]]
[[New York City]] | orig_lang = English | subject = | genre = Drama }} '''Six Degrees of Separation''' is a play written by [[Americans|American]] playwright [[John Guare]] that premiered in 1990. The play was nominated for the [[Pulitzer Prize for Drama]] and was nominated for the [[Tony Award for Best Play]].[http://www.pulitzer.org/bycat/Drama "Pulitzer Prize for Drama"] pulitzer.org, accessed November 13, 2015 The play explores the existential premise that everyone in the world is connected to everyone else in the world by a chain of no more than six acquaintances, thus, "[[six degrees of separation]]". ==Synopsis== A young black man named Paul shows up at the home of art dealer Flan Kittredge and his wife Louisa, known simply as "Ouisa", who live overlooking [[Central Park]] in New York City. Paul has a minor stab wound from an attempted mugging, and says he's a friend of their children at [[Harvard University]]. The Kittredges are trying to get the money to buy a painting by [[Paul Cézanne]]{{cite book|editor1-last=Krasner|editor1-first=David|title=A Companion to Twentieth-Century American Drama|date=2008|publisher=Wiley|isbn=9781405137348|page=364}}{{cite book|last1=Plunka|first1=Gene A.|title=The Black Comedy of John Guare|date=2002|publisher=U of Delaware P|isbn=9780874137637|page=190}} and now have this wounded stranger in their home. Paul claims he is in New York to meet his father, who is directing a film version of the [[Broadway musical]] ''[[Cats (musical)|Cats]].'' Paul continues to charm them with his story, though, in reality, it is all a lie: Paul is not a Harvard student but obtained details on the Kittredges from another male student he had seduced. Eventually Paul uses their home for an encounter with a hustler, but is caught red-handed. The police are called, but Paul escapes. Soon after, Paul starts up another con against a sensitive young man named Rick and his live-in girlfriend, Elizabeth. The naive young couple are new to the big city having just moved to New York from [[Utah]] and, based on Paul's con, invite him to live with them until he gets everything sorted out with his wealthy father—who Paul tells them is Flan Kittredge. The trio become good friends, with Paul spinning a tale of being estranged from his racist father; the girlfriend tells Rick not to lend Paul any money. One night Paul takes Rick out on the town, and seduces him in order to get the money. Later that night, Rick tells Elizabeth that Paul is gone, that he has all their money, and that he and Paul had sex. In a fit of fury, she cruelly suggests that Rick's father had always questioned his son's sexuality. Soon afterwards Rick commits suicide. In desperation, Paul calls the Kittredges for assistance. Partly due to strained relations with her children, Ouisa finds herself feeling emotionally attached to Paul, hoping to be able to help him in some way despite the fact that he has victimized them. Over a protracted and laborious phone call, he agrees to give himself up to the police; however, during the arrest, he and the couple are separated. Despite their efforts—Ouisa's more than Flan's—his fate is unresolved, except for a possibly tragic end. Towards the end of the play, in a climactic moment of reflection, she delivers the play's most famous [[monologue]]: {{cquote|''I read somewhere that everybody on this planet is separated by only six other people. Six degrees of separation. Between us and everybody else on this planet. The president of the United States. A gondolier in Venice. fill in the names. I find that A) tremendously comforting that we're so close and B) like Chinese water torture that we're so close. Because you have to find the right six people to make the connection. It's not just big names. It's anyone. A native in a rain forest. A Tierra del Fuegan. An Eskimo. I am bound to everyone on this planet by a trail of six people. It's a profound thought. How Paul found us. How to find the man whose son he pretends to be. Or perhaps is his son, although I doubt it. How every person is a new door, opening up into other worlds. Six degrees of separation between me and everyone else on this planet. But to find the right six people.''}} ==Historical casting== {| class="wikitable" width="80%" ! Character ! 1990 Off-Broadway cast ! 1990 Broadway cast ! 1992 West End cast ! 1993 Film cast ! 1st National Tour cast ! 2017 Broadway revival cast |- ! scope="row"| Ouisa Kittredge | align="center" colspan="4"| [[Stockard Channing]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Marlo Thomas]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Allison Janney]] |- ! scope="row"| Flan Kittredge | align="center" colspan="2"| John Cunningham | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Paul Shelley]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Donald Sutherland]] | align="center" colspan="1"| John Cunningham | align="center" colspan="1"| [[John Benjamin Hickey]] |- ! scope="row"| Paul | align="center" colspan="1"| [[James McDaniel]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Courtney B. Vance]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Adrian Lester]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Will Smith]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Ntare Mwine]] | align="center" colspan="1"| [[Corey Hawkins (actor)|Corey Hawkins]] |- |} [[Kristin Griffith]] and [[Swoosie Kurtz]] read the role of Ouisa Kittredge in workshops in 1989 before Stockard Channing was cast. Channing was originally unavailable and was committed to coming to Broadway in another play, [[Neil Simon]]'s ''[[Jake's Women]]''. The play's Broadway run was canceled. Channing had starred previously in John Guare's ''[[The House of Blue Leaves]]'', and he offered her the role for the official Off-Broadway run. Kurtz later replaced Channing during the Broadway run.[http://articles.latimes.com/1990-04-07/entertainment/ca-638_1_simon-jake-broadway Jake's Women canceled] accessed 11/23/2016[https://www.amazon.com/Six-Degrees-Separation-John-Guare/dp/0822210347 Play script notes] accessed 11/23/2016 ==Production history== The play premiered [[Off-Broadway]] at the [[Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts|Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater, Lincoln Center]], on May 16, 1990. Stockard Channing won an [[Obie Award for Distinguished Performance by an Actress|Obie Award]] for Best Actress for her performance. Guare won an Obie Award for his script. The production transferred to the [[Vivian Beaumont Theater]] for its [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] debut on November 8, 1990. The production closed on January 5, 1992 after 485 performances, directed by [[Jerry Zaks]].[http://www.playbillvault.com/Show/Detail/11250/Six-Degrees-of-Separation "'Six Degrees of Separation' Broadway"] playbillvault.com, accessed November 13, 2015[[Kelly Bishop]] played the role of Ouisa as a replacement on Broadway, and [[Laura Linney]] made her Broadway debut as a replacement for the role of Tess. The original Broadway production was nominated for four [[Tony Awards]], winning for Best Direction for Zaks. A US. National tour was launched in 1992.http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1993-04-04/features/9302030976_1_tour-off-broadway-six-degrees[[Veronica Hamel]] also played Ouisa in the first production in Chicago.http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1992-07-24/news/9203060876_1_six-degrees-john-guare-veronica-hamel The play made its UK debut in 1992 at the [[Royal Court Theatre]] and then transferred to the West End's [[Comedy Theatre]]. In 2010, the play was revived at the [[Old Vic]] theatre in London starring [[Lesley Manville]] as Ouisa.Billington, Michael. [https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2010/jan/20/six-degrees-of-separation-review "Review. 'Six Degrees of Separation'"] ''The Guardian'', 19 January 2010 A 1995 production at [[Canadian Stage]] in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]] starred [[Fiona Reid]] as Ouisa, Jim Mezon as Flan and [[Nigel Shawn Williams]] as Paul."Theatre Notes". ''[[Toronto Star]]'', January 12, 1995. Both Williams and Reid won [[Dora Mavor Moore Awards]] for their performances, Williams as [[Dora Mavor Moore Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male in a Principal Role – Play|Outstanding Performance by a Male in a Principal Role – Play]] and Reid as [[Dora Mavor Moore Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female in a Principal Role – Play|Outstanding Performance by a Female in a Principal Role – Play]]."Dora Winners". ''[[Toronto Star]]'', June 27, 1995. In May 2004 [[Michael Buffong]] directed a production at the [[Royal Exchange, Manchester]] with [[Lisa Eichhorn]] as Ouissa Kittredge, Phillip Bretherton as Flanders Kittredge and [[O-T Fagbenle]] as Paul. O-T Fabenle won a [[Manchester Evening News Theatre Awards|MEN Award]] for his performance. The play was revived on Broadway at the [[Ethel Barrymore Theatre]] in a limited engagement opening on April 5, 2017, starring [[Allison Janney]], [[John Benjamin Hickey]] and [[Corey Hawkins]], with direction by Trip Cullman.Paulson, Michael. [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/10/19/theater/allison-janney-returns-to-broadway-six-degrees-of-separation-revival.html?rref=collection/sectioncollection/arts "Allison Janney to Return to Broadway in ‘Six Degrees of Separation’ Revival",] ''The New York Times'', October 18, 2016Clement, Olivia. [http://www.playbill.com/article/six-degrees-of-separation-announces-rush-policy# " 'Six Degrees of Separation' Announces Rush Policy"] Playbill, March 29, 2017 ==Background== The play was inspired by the real-life story of [[David Hampton]], a [[confidence trick|con]] man and robber who managed to convince a number of people in the 1980s that he was the son of actor [[Sidney Poitier]]. The writer John Guare was a friend of [[Inger McCabe Elliott]] and her husband [[Osborn Elliott]]. In October 1983 Hampton came to the Elliott's New York apartment and they allowed him to spend the night. The next morning Inger Elliott found Hampton in bed with another man and later called the police. The Elliotts told Guare about the story and it inspired him to write the play years later.[https://books.google.com/books?id=9ugCAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA43&lpg=PA43&dq=stockard+channing+inger+elliott&source=bl&ots=3rs0iOwbSe&sig=E-5y6DRK5DqvvPcvkkYW6hG1H7s&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CB8Q6AEwAGoVChMI4-vi7u36xgIVyFk-Ch0sMgD7#v=onepage&q=stockard%20channing%20inger%20elliott&f=false New York Mag The Story of David Hampton ] accessed 7-27-2015 After the play became a dramatic and financial success, Hampton was tried and acquitted for harassment of Guare; he felt he was due a share of the profits that he ultimately never received.{{cite news | author=Larrt McShane | title=Six Degrees' Inspiration Hampton Dies | url=http://slick.org/deathwatch/mailarchive/msg01075.html | work=The Associated Press | date=19 July 2003 | accessdate=2008-08-17}} A strong influence on the play is the novel ''[[The Catcher in the Rye]]'' by [[J. D. Salinger]]. There are some very overt references to it, as when the protagonist explains the thesis paper he has just written on ''The Catcher in The Rye''[https://web.archive.org/web/20091027114943/http://www.geocities.com/exploring_citr/sixdegrees.htm] to the family who takes him in for the night.{{cite web | author=Colin L. Ryono | title=Six Degrees of Separation | url=http://www.whysanity.net/monos/sdop.html | publisher=Colin's Movie Monologue Page | date=2008 | accessdate=2008-08-31}} There are also more subtle [[allusions]] made both in the script and in the [[cinematography]] of the film version, such as when various characters begin to take on [[Holden Caulfield]]-esque characteristics and attitudes. ==Film adaptation== {{main article|Six Degrees of Separation (film)}} Guare adapted the play for a film released in 1993 directed by [[Fred Schepisi]]. Channing was nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Actress]] for her performance in the film. ==Awards and nominations== ===Original Broadway production=== {| class="wikitable" width="95%" |- ! width="5%"| Year ! width="25%"| Award ceremony ! width="40%"| Category ! width="20%"| Nominee ! width="10%"| Result |- | rowspan="12" align="center"| 1991 | rowspan="4"| [[Tony Award]] | colspan="2"| [[Tony Award for Best Play|Best Play]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Tony Award for Best Actor in a Play|Best Performance by a Leading Actor in a Play]] | [[Courtney B. Vance]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Tony Award for Best Actress in a Play|Best Performance by a Leading Actress in a Play]] | [[Stockard Channing]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Tony Award for Best Direction of a Play|Best Direction of a Play]] | [[Jerry Zaks]] | {{won}} |- | rowspan="3"| [[Drama Desk Award]] | colspan="2"| [[Drama Desk Award for Outstanding New Play|Outstanding New Play]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Actress in a Play|Outstanding Actress in a Play]] | [[Stockard Channing]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Director of a Play|Outstanding Director of a Play]] | [[Jerry Zaks]] | {{won}} |- | rowspan=3|[[Outer Critics Circle Award]] | colspan=2| Outstanding New Broadway Play | {{nom}} |- | Outstanding Actress in a Play | [[Stockard Channing]] | {{nom}} |- | Outstanding Director | [[Jerry Zaks]] | {{nom}} |- | [[New York Drama Critics' Circle|New York Drama Critics' Circle Award]] | Best Play | [[John Guare]] | {{won}} |- | [[Clarence Derwent Awards]] | Most Promising Male Performer | [[James McDaniel]] | {{won}} |} ===Original London production=== {| class="wikitable" width="95%" |- ! width="5%"| Year ! width="25%"| Award ceremony ! width="40%"| Category ! width="20%"| Nominee ! width="10%"| Result |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 1993 | rowspan="2"| [[Laurence Olivier Award]] | colspan="2"| [[Laurence Olivier Award for Best New Play|Best New Play]] | {{won}} |- | [[Laurence Olivier Award for Best Actress|Best Actress in a Play]] | [[Stockard Channing]] | {{nom}} |- |} ===2017 Broadway revival=== {| class="wikitable" width="95%" |- ! width="5%"| Year ! width="25%"| Award ceremony ! width="40%"| Category ! width="20%"| Nominee ! width="10%"| Result |- | rowspan="6" align="center"| 2017 | rowspan="2"| [[Tony Award]] | colspan=2|[[Tony Award for Best Revival of a Play|Best Revival of a Play]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Tony Award for Best Actor in a Play|Best Performance by a Leading Actor in a Play]] | [[Corey Hawkins]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Outer Critics Circle Award]] | Outstanding Actress in a Play | [[Allison Janney]] | {{nom}} |- | rowspan=3|[[Drama League Award]] | colspan=2|Outstanding Revival of a Play | {{nom}} |- | rowspan=2|Distinguished Performance | [[Corey Hawkins]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Allison Janney]] | {{nom}} |} ==See also== * [[Small world phenomenon]] * [[Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon]] (game) * [[Erdős number]] ==References== ==Further reading== * {{cite book | last=Guare | first=John | title=Six Degrees of Separation: A Play | edition=First | location=New York | publisher=Random House | year=1990 | isbn=0-679-40161-X}} * {{cite book | last=Salinger | first=J. D. | title=The Catcher in the Rye | edition=First | location=Boston | publisher=Little, Brown | year=1951 | isbn=0-316-76953-3}} * Wolfe, Graham. (2012). “Doorways and Blank Spaces: Intertextual Connection in John Guare’s Six Degrees of Separation.” ''Intertextual Exchanges in American Drama''. Eds. Drew Eisenhauer and Brenda Murphy. Jefferson: McFarland. 217–231. ==External links== * {{IBDB show|8061|Six Degrees of Separation}} * {{IBDB title|4622|Six Degrees of Separation}} * {{iobdb title| 1080}} * Article on ''Six Degrees of Separation''[https://www.academia.edu/2040178/_Doorways_and_Blank_Spaces_Intertextual_Connection_in_John_Guares_Six_Degrees_of_Separation._] {{OlivierAward Play 1976–2000}} [[Category:1990 plays]] [[Category:American plays adapted into films]] [[Category:Broadway plays]] [[Category:Laurence Olivier Award-winning plays]] [[Category:LGBT-related plays]] [[Category:New York Drama Critics' Circle Award winners]] [[Category:Off-Broadway plays]] [[Category:Plays about race and ethnicity]] [[Category:Plays based on actual events]] [[Category:Plays set in New York City]] [[Category:Plays set in the 1990s]] [[Category:West End plays]]

revision.text:
{{BLP primary sources|date=January 2016}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = Steve Vai | image = Steve Vai 2011.jpg | caption = Vai in 2015 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Steven Siro Vai | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1960|6|6}} | birth_place = [[Carle Place, New York]], U.S. | instrument = Guitar, vocals | genre = {{flatlist| *[[Instrumental rock]] *[[hard rock]] *[[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] *[[progressive rock]] *[[progressive metal]] *[[experimental rock]] }} | years_active = 1978–present | label = {{flatlist| *[[Favored Nations]] *[[Relativity Records|Relativity]] *[[Epic Records|Epic]] }} | associated_acts = {{flatlist| *[[Joe Satriani]] *[[Eric Johnson]] *[[Paul Gilbert]] *[[Frank Zappa]] *[[Alcatrazz]] *[[David Lee Roth]] *[[Whitesnake]] *[[Meat Loaf]] *[[Zappa Plays Zappa]] *[[Devin Townsend]] *[[Billy Sheehan]] *[[G3 (tour)|G3]] *[[2Cellos]] }} | website = {{URL|vai.com}} }}
'''Steven Siro Vai''' ({{IPAc-en|v|aɪ}}; born June 6, 1960) is an American guitarist, composer, singer, songwriter, and producer. A three-time [[Grammy Award]] winner and fifteen-time nominee,<ref name="tecawards.org"/> Vai started his music career in 1978 at the age of eighteen as a transcriptionist for [[Frank Zappa]],<ref>{{Cite web|title = Tempo Mental - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/tempo-mental/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-11-23|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151118183801/http://www.vai.com/tempo-mental/|archivedate = November 18, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> and joined his band from 1980 to 1983.<ref name="tecawards.org"/> He embarked on a solo career in 1983 and has released eight solo albums to date.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai (main discography)|url = http://www.discogs.com/artist/221183-Steve-Vai|website = Discogs|accessdate = 2015-11-23|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160310224227/https://www.discogs.com/artist/221183-Steve-Vai|archivedate = March 10, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> He has recorded and toured with [[Alcatrazz]], [[David Lee Roth]], [[Whitesnake]], as well as having recorded with artists such as [[Mary J. Blige]], [[Spinal Tap (band)|Spinal Tap]], and [[Ozzy Osbourne]]. Additionally, Vai has toured with live-only acts [[G3 (tour)|G3]], [[Zappa Plays Zappa]], the Experience Hendrix tour, as well as headlining international tours.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Bands - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/bands/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-11-23|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151110041239/http://www.vai.com/bands/|archivedate = November 10, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
Vai has been described as a "highly individualistic player" and part of a generation of "heavy rock and metal virtuosi who came to the fore in the 1980s".<ref>{{Cite book|title = The New Guitarscape in Critical Theory, Cultural Practice and Musical Performance|url = https://books.google.nl/books?id=MVdv-h-1WQ0C&pg=PA66#v=onepage&q&f=false|publisher = Ashgate Publishing, Ltd.|date = 2010-01-01|isbn = 9780754667759|first = Kevin|last = Dawe|page = 66|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105044731/https://books.google.nl/books?id=MVdv-h-1WQ0C&pg=PA66#v=onepage&q&f=false|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> He released his first solo album ''[[Flex-Able]]'' in 1984, while his most successful release, ''[[Passion and Warfare]]'' (1990), was described as "the richest and best hard rock guitar-virtuoso album of the '80s".<ref>{{Cite web|title = Passion and Warfare - Steve Vai {{!}} Songs, Reviews, Credits {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/album/passion-and-warfare-mw0000308521|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.allmusic.com/album/passion-and-warfare-mw0000308521|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> He was voted the "10th Greatest Guitarist" by ''[[Guitar World]]'' magazine,<ref name="guitarworld.com">{{Cite web|title = Readers Poll Results: The 100 Greatest Guitarists of All Time|url = http://www.guitarworld.com/readers-poll-results-100-greatest-guitarists-all-time#slide-90|website = Guitar World|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121025131228/http://www.guitarworld.com/readers-poll-results-100-greatest-guitarists-all-time#slide-90|archivedate = October 25, 2012|df = mdy-all}}</ref> and has sold over 15 million records.<ref name="tecawards.org">{{Cite web|url =https://www.tecawards.org/les-paul-award|title =Les Paul/TEC Awards Information and Recipients|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|deadurl =no|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20151008102619/https://www.tecawards.org/les-paul-award|archivedate =October 8, 2015|df =mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai {{!}} Awards {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/artist/steve-vai-mn0000045475/awards|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160604152835/https://www.allmusic.com/artist/steve-vai-mn0000045475/awards|archivedate = June 4, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
==Biography== ===Early life=== Steve Vai, a descendant of [[Italian Americans|Italian immigrants]], was born in [[Carle Place, New York]] on June 6, 1960. He is the fourth son of John and Theresa Vai.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai: the 10 Records That Changed My Life|url = http://www.teamrock.com/features/2015-12-15/steve-vai-the-10-records-that-changed-my-life|website = TeamRock|publisher = |date = 2015-12-15|accessdate = 2016-01-10|language = en-GB|first = Joe|last = Bosso|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160128114634/http://www.teamrock.com/features/2015-12-15/steve-vai-the-10-records-that-changed-my-life|archivedate = January 28, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> He described his first experiences with music as, "at the age of five I walked up to [a] piano, hit a note, and noticed that to the right the notes go higher and to the left the notes go lower. In that very moment, I had a full-on epiphany. I was flooded with the instinctual realization of how music was created and how it worked from a theoretical standpoint—the whole language of music was very obvious. I also understood immediately, instinctually, and unequivocally something that has only deepened through the years that the creation of music is an infinite personal expression. I realized that I could do this, I could make music, and it could be whatever I want."<ref name="http://facebook.com/MakeWeirdMusic">{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Interview · Make Weird Music|url = http://www.makeweirdmusic.com/interview/steve-vai/|website = Make Weird Music|publisher = MakeWeirdMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-28|language = |deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.makeweirdmusic.com/interview/steve-vai/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Musician's Friend Exclusive Interview with Steve Vai, Part I Buyer's Guide {{!}} Musicians Friend|url = http://www.musiciansfriend.com/resources/article/Musicians-Friend-Exclusive-Interview-with-Steve-Vai-Part-I/m710806|website = www.musiciansfriend.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151226081151/http://www.musiciansfriend.com/resources/article/Musicians-Friend-Exclusive-Interview-with-Steve-Vai-Part-I/m710806|archivedate = December 26, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="americansongwriter.com">{{Cite web|title = Q&A: Steve Vai Drops Some Knowledge « American Songwriter|url = http://americansongwriter.com/2012/10/qa-steve-vai-drops-some-knowledge/|website = American Songwriter|publisher = |accessdate = 2015-12-28|language = en-US|deadurl = no|archiveurl = http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20151230223246/http://americansongwriter.com/2012/10/qa-steve-vai-drops-some-knowledge/|archivedate = December 30, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
It was a year later, at the age of six, that Vai experienced his first introduction to the guitar, remembering that, "I saw this nine-year-old boy playing the guitar in my grade school auditorium, and that was another epiphany that I had. It was my first recognition of the instrument. When I saw that guitar and I saw this kid playing it, I knew instinctually that I was going to play the guitar someday, and that it would be my instrument. Don't ask me how I knew, I just knew. It was the coolest thing I had ever seen."<ref name="http://facebook.com/MakeWeirdMusic"/><ref name="americansongwriter.com"/>
As a young child, Vai was influenced by the music his parents had listened to. One album in particular that he cites as his "musical awakening" was the original motion picture soundtrack to the 1961 film ''[[West Side Story (soundtrack)|West Side Story]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|title = The Record that Changed My Life: Steve Vai Discusses 'West Side Story: Original Broadway Cast Recording'|url = http://www.guitarworld.com/record-changed-my-life-steve-vai-discusses-west-side-story-original-broadway-cast-recording|website = Guitar World|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105121231/http://www.guitarworld.com/record-changed-my-life-steve-vai-discusses-west-side-story-original-broadway-cast-recording|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> At age eleven, Vai was introduced to the contemporary rock and [[progressive rock|progressive]] music of the era, and after hearing the guitar solo to [[Led Zeppelin]]'s "[[Heartbreaker (Led Zeppelin song)|Heartbreaker]]" at age twelve, decided to begin playing the guitar.
In 1973, Vai began to take guitar lessons from fellow New York native [[Joe Satriani]], and played in local bands (The Ohio Express, Circus, and Rayge) throughout his high school years.<ref>{{Cite web|title = 10 Things You Didn't Know About Steve Vai|url = http://ultimateclassicrock.com/10-things-you-didnt-know-about-steve-vai/|website = Ultimate Classic Rock|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225080806/http://ultimateclassicrock.com/10-things-you-didnt-know-about-steve-vai/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> Vai cites artists such as [[Jimmy Page]], [[Brian May]], [[Ritchie Blackmore]], [[Jeff Beck]], [[Jimi Hendrix]], as well as [[jazz fusion]] guitarists [[Allan Holdsworth]] and [[Al Di Meola]] as some of his major influences in that time period.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Music Influences|url = http://www.mtv.com/artists/steve-vai/related-artists/?filter=influencedBy|website = MTV Artists|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.mtv.com/artists/steve-vai/related-artists/?filter=influencedBy|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> In 1978, to further pursue his interest in music composition and theory, Vai attended [[Berklee College of Music]] in [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]]. While at Berklee, Vai began working for [[Frank Zappa]] as a transcriptionist, and in the middle of his fourth semester, moved to California to start his career as a session and touring artist for Zappa.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Berklee Press: An Interview with Steve Vai|url = http://www.berkleepress.com/newsletter/steve_vai.htm|website = www.berkleepress.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150901080843/http://www.berkleepress.com/newsletter/steve_vai.htm|archivedate = September 1, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> Also while at Berklee, Vai met his future spouse [[Pia Maiocco]], with whom he has been together since; they have two children.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Pia Maiocco|url = https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0583921/|website = IMDb|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0583921/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> In 2003, Vai was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Music from [[Berklee]]. <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thefreelibrary.com/Steven+Tyler,+Steve+Vai,+and+Patty+Larkin+Among+Five+High+Profile...-a0115904470|title=Steven Tyler, Steve Vai, and Patty Larkin Among Five High Profile Artists and Composers Supporting Berklee's New Online Music Scholarship; Berklee Honorary Doctor of Music Degree Recipient, Steven Tyler, and Berklee Alumni Steve Vai, Patty Larkin, Alf Clausen, and Tom Snow Back Positive 'Music and the Internet' Initiative. - Free Online Library|website=www.thefreelibrary.com|accessdate=July 14, 2017}}</ref>
===Early music career (1979–1986)=== [[Image:Frank Zappa.jpg|thumb|Steve Vai (on guitar in between the drums and keyboard, to the right), [[Frank Zappa]] and band during a concert at the [[Buffalo Memorial Auditorium|Memorial Auditorium]] in [[Buffalo, New York]] (October 25, 1980)]] In 1978, Vai sent both a notated transcription of Frank Zappa's "[[The Black Page]]", and a recording of his college band, Morning Thunder, to Zappa.<ref name="berkleepress.com">{{Cite web|title = Berklee Press: An Interview with Steve Vai|url = http://www.berkleepress.com/newsletter/steve_vai.htm|website = www.berkleepress.com|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150901080843/http://www.berkleepress.com/newsletter/steve_vai.htm|archivedate = September 1, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Vaiography - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/vaiography/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227031927/http://www.vai.com/vaiography/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> Impressed by this, Zappa responded by putting Vai on salary as a [[transcriptionist]] to transcribe his work, which included pieces from the ''[[Joe's Garage]]'' and ''[[Shut Up 'n Play Yer Guitar]]'' albums.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Tempo Mental - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/tempo-mental/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151219101709/http://www.vai.com/tempo-mental/|archivedate = December 19, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> After leaving [[Berklee College of Music]] and moving to California, Vai auditioned<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.berkleeshares.com/guitar/stevevai|title=Steve Vai On His Audition for Frank Zappa's Band -|last=Online|first=Berklee|website=www.berkleeshares.com|access-date=2017-03-31|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170401232757/http://www.berkleeshares.com/guitar/stevevai|archivedate=April 1, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> for and became a full-time member of Zappa's band, going on his first tour with Zappa in the fall of 1980.<ref name="berkleepress.com"/> Zappa often referred to Vai as his "little Italian virtuoso",<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai|url = https://www.namm.org/library/oral-history/steve-vai|website = NAMM.org|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151222110714/https://www.namm.org/library/oral-history/steve-vai|archivedate = December 22, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> and Vai is frequently listed in the liner notes of Zappa's albums as having performed "stunt" or "impossible" guitar parts.<ref name="Play Like Steve Vai">{{Cite web|title = Play Like Steve Vai|url = http://www.guitarplayer.com/artists/1026/10-things-you-gotta-do-to-play-like-steve-vai/21995|website = www.guitarplayer.com|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151222090709/http://www.guitarplayer.com/artists/1026/10-things-you-gotta-do-to-play-like-steve-vai/21995|archivedate = December 22, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
Vai was a featured artist on the 1993 release ''[[Zappa's Universe]]'', and in 2006, Vai appeared as a special guest on [[Dweezil Zappa]]'s [[Zappa Plays Zappa]] tour; both projects won Vai a [[Grammy Award]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Awards|publisher = vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/awards/|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225095812/http://www.vai.com/awards/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
After moving on from Zappa's employ in 1983, Vai bought a house in [[Sylmar, Los Angeles]], where he built his first professional studio.<ref>{{Cite web|title = The Studios - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/the-studios/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227025257/http://www.vai.com/the-studios/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> During this period, Vai formed two bands (The Classified and 777)<ref>{{Cite web|title = Bands - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/bands/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227041625/http://www.vai.com/bands/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> as well as writing and recording a large amount of music that was not originally intended for release. Out of this material, Vai compiled his first studio album ''[[Flex-Able]]''. He created his own record label, [[Akashic records|Akashic Records]] (later Light Without Heat Records), which he used to take ''Flex-Able'' directly to distribution channels.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Vai.com - The Official Steve Vai Website: Disc Notes - Flex-Able|url = http://www.vai.com/AllAboutSteve/disconotes_flexable.html|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-22|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304051804/http://www.vai.com/AllAboutSteve/disconotes_flexable.html|archivedate = March 4, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> ''Flex-Able'' was released in January 1984.
Vai began his rise to public acclaim in 1983 when, shortly before the release of ''Flex-Able'', his composition "[[The Attitude Song]]" was published in ''[[Guitar Player]]'' magazine.<ref name="Play Like Steve Vai"/> The song centered itself on a main guitar riff in the [[time signature]] 7/16, played over a rhythm section centered in 4/4. Each following section of the song showcased a number of specialized techniques (such as [[tapping#Two-handed tapping|two-handed tapping]], [[whammy bar|whammy bar acrobatics]], [[sweep-picking|sweep picking]], [[alternate picking]], [[harmony|multi-part harmonies]], and odd [[phrase (music)|phrasing]]) used in angular and exaggerated ways that were unique to the song at the time.<ref name="Play Like Steve Vai"/> Interest from the public eye grew more so when Vai's song "Blue Powder" (a demonstration for the [[Carvin Corporation|Carvin]] X100b [[guitar amplifier|amplifier]]) was published in ''Guitar Player'' as well, which showed the virtuoso side of Vai's compositional process. Also in 1986, Vai was cast in the [[blockbuster (entertainment)|blockbuster]] film ''[[Crossroads (1986 film)|Crossroads]]'' as the Devil's guitar player "Jack Butler". In the famous "duel scene" between Vai and [[Ralph Macchio]]'s characters, Vai wrote and performed all guitar parts with the exception of the slide guitar, which was performed by [[Ry Cooder]].<ref>{{Cite web|url = https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0090888/soundtrack|title = Crossroads (1986)|date = |accessdate = |publisher = IMDb|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0090888/soundtrack|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
In between solo work, Vai replaced [[Yngwie Malmsteen]] in June 1984 as the lead guitarist of [[Alcatrazz]], with whom he recorded the album ''[[Disturbing the Peace (album)|Disturbing the Peace]]''. Vai left shortly after the subsequent tour to join [[David Lee Roth]]'s band.
===With David Lee Roth (1985–1989)=== In 1985, Vai joined David Lee Roth's post-[[Van Halen]] band as [[lead guitar]]ist, together with former [[Talas (band)|Talas]] Bassist [[Billy Sheehan]] on bass; and former [[Maynard Ferguson]] drummer [[Gregg Bissonette]] on drums. The foursome's debut album ''[[Eat 'Em and Smile]]'', released on July 7, 1986, was both a critical and commercial success, reaching number four on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] albums chart and selling over two million copies. ''[[Guitar World]]'' magazine editor [[Brad Tolinski]] commented on Vai's playing at the time, saying that "Steve Vai's guitar wizardry is so profound that in earlier times he would have been burned as a witch."<ref>{{Cite web|url =http://www.hdtracks.com/music/artist/view/id/2338/|title =Steve Vai|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|deadurl =no|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20151223154823/http://www.hdtracks.com/music/artist/view/id/2338/|archivedate =December 23, 2015|df =mdy-all}}</ref> Retrospectively, ''Eat 'Em and Smile'' is frequently evaluated as one of the greatest rock albums of the 1980s.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Metal Odyssey's Good Times Album Pick: David Lee Roth - "Eat 'Em and Smile"|url = http://metalodyssey.net/2010/04/01/metal-odysseys-good-times-album-pick-david-lee-roth-eat-em-and-smile/|website = Metal Odyssey > Heavy Metal Music Blog|accessdate = 2015-12-23|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151223140528/http://metalodyssey.net/2010/04/01/metal-odysseys-good-times-album-pick-david-lee-roth-eat-em-and-smile/|archivedate = December 23, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> The group's [[Eat 'Em and Smile Tour]] began in August 1986 and continued through February 1987.
Roth's subsequent album ''[[Skyscraper (album)|Skyscraper]]'', released in 1988, was produced by both Roth and Vai.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Discusses His Albums with David Lee Roth & Van Halen's 'A Different Kind Of Truth'|url = http://www.vhnd.com/2012/08/21/steve-vai-discusses-a-different-kind-of-truth-his-albums-with-david-lee-roth/|website = Van Halen News Desk|accessdate = 2015-12-23|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151223092347/http://www.vhnd.com/2012/08/21/steve-vai-discusses-a-different-kind-of-truth-his-albums-with-david-lee-roth/|archivedate = December 23, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> Like its predecessor, the album was a commercial success, reaching number six on the ''Billboard'' 200 chart. In 1989, following the successful [[Skyscraper Tour]], Vai departed from the band.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Special « martingoulding.com|url = http://martingoulding.com/lessons/special-features/steve-vai-special/|website = martingoulding.com|accessdate = 2015-12-23|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160208232521/http://martingoulding.com/lessons/special-features/steve-vai-special/|archivedate = February 8, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> He was replaced by Cacophony guitarist [[Jason Becker]].
In 1985, after having joined Roth's band, Vai designed the [[Ibanez JEM|JEM]] guitar, a unique instrument that incorporated a series of groundbreaking designs that have since become staples in feature throughout the guitar industry. Vai began working with Ibanez in 1986 to develop the guitar, and the first production Ibanez JEM 777 guitars were released in 1987.
===1990s=== [[Image:Ibanez dbl neck jem.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Vai playing a [[multi-neck guitar|twin-necked]] Ibanez, {{circa}} 1990s]] From 1985 to 1990, Vai recorded ''[[Passion and Warfare]]'' at his home studio, his second studio solo album.<ref>{{Cite web|title = The Studios - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/the-studios/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227025257/http://www.vai.com/the-studios/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="vai.com">{{Cite web|title = Album – Passion & Warfare - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/album-passion-warfare/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225052602/http://www.vai.com/album-passion-warfare/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> After leaving Roth's band in 1989, Vai bought out of his [[Capitol Records]] contract and signed on with [[Relativity Records]] for the release of ''Passion and Warfare'', which was completed shortly after he began recording the guitar parts for [[Whitesnake]]'s ''[[Slip of the Tongue]]'' album, where he replaced the injured [[Adrian Vandenberg]].<ref name="vai.com"/>
Upon its release in November 1989, ''Slip of the Tongue'' sold over three million copies worldwide, reaching number 10 on the ''Billboard'' 200 while Vai joined the band on their thirteen-month world tour.<ref name="vai.com"/><ref>{{Cite web|title = Bands - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/bands/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227041625/http://www.vai.com/bands/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Slip of the Tongue - Whitesnake {{!}} Songs, Reviews, Credits {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/album/slip-of-the-tongue-mw0000653833|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.allmusic.com/album/slip-of-the-tongue-mw0000653833|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
In September 1990, Vai released ''Passion and Warfare'' through Relativity Records,<ref name="vai.com"/> and within the first week of release, the album had reached number 18 in the ''Billboard'' 200, selling over a million and a half copies worldwide.<ref name="vai.com"/><ref>{{Cite web|title = Passion and Warfare - Steve Vai {{!}} Awards {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/album/passion-and-warfare-mw0000308521/awards|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225064346/http://www.allmusic.com/album/passion-and-warfare-mw0000308521/awards|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="musicradar.com">{{Cite web|title = Interview: Steve Vai talks about his solo studio recordings|url = http://www.musicradar.com/news/guitars/interview-steve-vai-talks-about-his-solo-studio-recordings-555180|website = MusicRadar|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225033650/http://www.musicradar.com/news/guitars/interview-steve-vai-talks-about-his-solo-studio-recordings-555180|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> ''Passion and Warfare'' won Vai a number of awards such as ''Guitar World'' and ''Guitar Player'''s "Best Album" and "Best Rock Guitarist" awards.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Awards - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/awards/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225095812/http://www.vai.com/awards/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> ''Passion and Warfare'' has been cited as one of the most pertinent instrumental albums released.<ref>{{Cite web|url =http://www.allmusic.com/album/passion-and-warfare-mw0000308521|title =Passion and Warfare- AllMusic|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|deadurl =no|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.allmusic.com/album/passion-and-warfare-mw0000308521|archivedate =January 5, 2016|df =mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Fascinating Facts About Steve Vai’s Passion And Warfare|url = http://iheartguitarblog.com/2015/09/fascinating-facts-about-steve-vais-passion-and-warfare.html#sthash.FUgPsPpm.dpbs|website = I Heart Guitar|accessdate = 2015-12-28|language = en-US|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151229172801/http://iheartguitarblog.com/2015/09/fascinating-facts-about-steve-vais-passion-and-warfare.html#sthash.FUgPsPpm.dpbs|archivedate = December 29, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
1990 also saw the release of the [[Ibanez Universe]] [[seven-string guitar]] co-designed by Vai in conjunction with Ibanez. Vai left Whitesnake in 1990 to pursue his own musical avenues, and formed a band that included [[Devin Townsend]] on vocals, [[T. M. Stevens]] on bass, and [[Terry Bozzio]] on drums.<ref name="musicradar.com" /> The group released ''[[Sex & Religion]]'' on July 23, 1993, that was described as visceral in nature, combining a compositional and [[progressive metal]] rhythm section with Devin Townsend's vocal arrangements.<ref name="ReferenceA">{{Cite web|title = Album – Sex & Religion - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/album-sex-religion/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225043250/http://www.vai.com/album-sex-religion/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> After the following tour in support of the album, the group disbanded.<ref name="musicradar.com" /><ref name="ReferenceA" /> Vai began working with [[Ozzy Osbourne]] in 1994, with whom he wrote and recorded the ''[[Ozzmosis]]'' album. Due to label conflicts, the album was re-written and recorded with [[Zakk Wylde]] on guitar.<ref>{{Cite web|title = 10 Things You Didn't Know About Steve Vai|url = http://ultimateclassicrock.com/10-things-you-didnt-know-about-steve-vai/|website = Ultimate Classic Rock|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225080806/http://ultimateclassicrock.com/10-things-you-didnt-know-about-steve-vai/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> In 1994, Vai won a Grammy award for his performance of "Sofa", from ''Zappa's Universe''.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Awards - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/awards/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-26|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225095812/http://www.vai.com/awards/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
While recording his fourth studio album ''[[Fire Garden]]'', Vai took time to record and release the stripped down EP ''[[Alien Love Secrets]]''.<ref name="ReferenceB">{{Cite web|title = Album – Alien Love Secrets - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/album-alien-love-secrets/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225033127/http://www.vai.com/album-alien-love-secrets/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> A departure from the often highly compositional and heavily produced style of his previous projects, the seven-track EP was recorded in four weeks and released through Relativity/[[Epic Records]] on March 21, 1995.<ref name="musicradar.com" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.discogs.com/Steve-Vai-Alien-Love-Secrets/release/3865831|title=Steve Vai - Alien Love Secrets|website=Discogs|access-date=2016-03-13|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160730175557/https://www.discogs.com/Steve-Vai-Alien-Love-Secrets/release/3865831|archivedate=July 30, 2016|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Vai cites this record as one of his favorites, saying "The recording and release of ''Alien Love Secrets'' marked another turning point in my personal evolution. I was more concerned with making the record that I wanted to make, and not worry about what some others thought I should be doing."<ref name="ReferenceB" />
On September 17, 1996, Vai released ''Fire Garden'', 19-track double album, through Epic,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.discogs.com/Steve-Vai-Fire-Garden/release/378320|title=Steve Vai - Fire Garden|website=Discogs|access-date=2016-03-13|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160801022057/https://www.discogs.com/Steve-Vai-Fire-Garden/release/378320|archivedate=August 1, 2016|df=mdy-all}}</ref> with the first half being primarily instrumental while the second half featured Vai on vocals.<ref name="musicradar.com" /> After the release of ''Fire Garden'', Vai joined his former teacher [[Joe Satriani]], along with guitarist [[Eric Johnson]], for the second installment of the ongoing [[G3 (tour)|G3]] concert tours. On each G3 tour, three guitar-centric headlining acts are chosen to perform their own sets, and then collectively jam to fan favorite songs at the end of the show.<ref>{{Cite web|title = G3 Tour: 1996|url = http://www.satriani.com/G3/1996.html|website = www.satriani.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151104073003/http://www.satriani.com/G3/1996.html|archivedate = November 4, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> ''[[G3: Live in Concert]]'', a video of the 1996 tour was filmed in [[Columbus, Ohio]] and released on June 3, 1997.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Joe Satriani - discography > g3 live in concert|url = http://www.satriani.com/discography/G3_Live_In_Concert/|website = www.satriani.com|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.satriani.com/discography/G3_Live_In_Concert/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
In 1998, Vai independently released a performance footage DVD of ''Alien Love Secrets''.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai - Alien Love Secrets|url = http://www.discogs.com/Steve-Vai-Alien-Love-Secrets/release/2541838|website = Discogs|accessdate = 2015-12-24|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.discogs.com/Steve-Vai-Alien-Love-Secrets/release/2541838|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> Also in 1998, Vai started the Make a Noise Foundation with his then-manager [[Ruta Sepetys]]. The goal of the foundation was to provide funding for musical education to those otherwise unable to attain it. Today, Vai often auctions items in his possession with proceeds going to the foundation.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Make A Noise - Mission|url = http://www.makeanoise.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=16&Itemid=28|website = www.makeanoise.org|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105065548/http://www.makeanoise.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=16&Itemid=28|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
===2000s=== [[Image:Steve Vai2001.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Vai performing in 2001]] In December 2001, Vai recorded two performances at [[London Astoria|The Astoria]] in London, with his band The Breed (composed of former David Lee Roth bandmate Billy Sheehan, guitarist/pianist [[Tony MacAlpine]], guitarist [[Dave Weiner]], and drummer [[Virgil Donati]]). This live show was released independently in DVD format as ''[[Live at the Astoria, London|Steve Vai: Live at the Astoria, London]]'' in 2003, and was Vai's first of many successful live concert DVD projects.<ref>{{Cite web|url =https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0430632/|title =IMDb- Steve Vai: Live At The Astoria London|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|deadurl =no|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0430632/|archivedate =January 5, 2016|df =mdy-all}}</ref> In 2004, Vai released twelve tracks from the DVD in an online only release.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Live at the Astoria - Steve Vai {{!}} Songs, Reviews, Credits {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/album/live-at-the-astoria-mw0001007027|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.allmusic.com/album/live-at-the-astoria-mw0001007027|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
2001 saw the [[special edition|limited]] release of ''[[The Secret Jewel Box]]'', a conceptual ten-CD box set containing unique material from various eras of Vai's career. Four compilation albums (''[[The Elusive Light and Sound, Vol. 1]]''; ''[[Mystery Tracks – Archives Vol. 3]]''; ''[[Various Artists – Archives Vol. 4]]''; and ''[[Vai: Piano Reductions, Vol. 1]]'') included as part of the box set, were released to the public both in 2001 and the years following.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Vai.com : The Secret Jewel Box : About the Box|url = http://www.vai.com/minisites/boxset/about.html|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160303194043/http://www.vai.com/minisites/boxset/about.html|archivedate = March 3, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> Also in 2001, Vai's record label [[Favored Nations]] released ''[[No Substitutions: Live in Osaka]]''. The release, which Vai himself produced and engineered, won him his second [[Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Instrumental Album|Grammy award for Best Pop Instrumental Album]] in February 2002.<ref name="ReferenceC">{{Cite web|title = Awards - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/awards/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151225095812/http://www.vai.com/awards/|archivedate = December 25, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
While most widely recognized for his stature as a rock guitar player, Vai is also a musical composer fluent in the composition and arranging of [[orchestra]]l music. In May 2004, Vai premiered "The Aching Hunger", a project commissioned by the Netherlands Programme Service and performed with the Netherlands' [[Metropole Orkest|Metropole Orchestra]]. "The Aching Hunger" performances consisted of two parts: the first showcasing Vai's original contemporary orchestral compositions, and the second consisting of Vai (on guitar) playing newly arranged material from his catalog with the orchestra.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Vai.com - The Official Steve Vai Website > Inside Real Illusions: Reflections|url = http://www.vai.com/minisites/realillusions/07lotusfeet.html|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160303175927/http://www.vai.com/minisites/realillusions/07lotusfeet.html|archivedate = March 3, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> This project yielded both the ''[[Visual Sound Theories]]'' DVD and the ''[[Sound Theories Vol. I & II]]'' album, which were recorded in 2005 during multiple "Aching Hunger" performances and released in June 2007.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Sound Theories, Vols. 1-2 - Steve Vai {{!}} Songs, Reviews, Credits {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/album/sound-theories-vols-1-2-mw0000470643|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.allmusic.com/album/sound-theories-vols-1-2-mw0000470643|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> While "The Aching Hunger" and its following releases started Vai's public career as an orchestral composer, Vai had been composing since he began a music theory class (taught by Bill Westcott) in high school. In speaking of Westcott, Vai says "He taught me how to write, compose and appreciate music. There was no greater musical influence in my life."<ref>{{Cite web|title = Bill Westcott - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/bill-westcott-3/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227123126/http://www.vai.com/bill-westcott-3/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
In 2005, Vai released ''[[Real Illusions: Reflections]]'', the first installment in an ongoing three-part trilogy concept album. Each of the three installments to the series contain material (songs, lyrics, and both spoken and written narration) with particular relationships to the storyline, purposefully left out of order. Upon the release of the third installment, Vai intends to complete a fourth album of material, which will then be released with the previous three installments and completed storyline in order.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Vai.com - The Official Steve Vai Website > Inside Real Illusions: Reflections|url = http://www.vai.com/minisites/realillusions/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304003029/http://www.vai.com/minisites/realillusions/|archivedate = March 4, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Real Illusions: Reflections - Steve Vai {{!}} Songs, Reviews, Credits {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/album/real-illusions-reflections-mw0000261218|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.allmusic.com/album/real-illusions-reflections-mw0000261218|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> In speaking of the storyline, Vai says "It's a human interest story, about the human condition. ... It's a story about this man who has a traumatic experience in his life, and it drives him insane. We see the story through his eyes. It also involves the town he lives in and this stranger that enters the town who's like a shaman; he builds this giant edifice, like a reflecting pond, and when people come to it they see aspects of their personalities and identities and discover things about themselves. There's some comedy involved, too, but it's pretty esoteric. It's about a lot of lofty principles, so it's not a bad idea to dish this all out slowly."<ref>{{Cite web|title = Interview: Steve Vai Breaks Down His New Album, 'The Story of Light'|url = http://www.guitarworld.com/interview-steve-vai-breaks-down-his-new-album-story-light|website = Guitar World|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227124107/http://www.guitarworld.com/interview-steve-vai-breaks-down-his-new-album-story-light|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> The installments to the series will be released over periods of time, with the second, ''[[The Story of Light (Steve Vai album)|The Story of Light]]'', having been released in 2012.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Album – The Story of Light - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/album-the-story-of-light/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227135232/http://www.vai.com/album-the-story-of-light/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
In 2006, Vai joined the [[Zappa Plays Zappa]] tour as a special guest, alongside additional Zappa band alumni Terry Bozzio and [[Napoleon Murphy Brock]]. In 2008, for his performance of "Peaches en Regalia" from the Zappa Plays Zappa tour, Vai won his third [[Grammy Award for Best Rock Instrumental Performance]].<ref name="ReferenceC"/> Having always enjoyed the aspect of teaching and sharing his experiences in life and in the music business,{{Citation needed|date = April 2016}} Vai began a series of "Alien Guitar Secrets" masterclasses in 2006- a touring masterclass in which Vai holds open forum discussion about his own experiences in the music industry, explains the key principles to understanding success, plays to backing tracks (often inviting class attendees to jam with him), answers questions, articulates key points of guitar technique, and more importantly goes beyond the technique and into the more profound esoteric principles at play (see Notable contributions for more on this).
In support of ''Sound Theories Vol. I & II'' and ''Visual Sound Theories'', Vai put together a new band for a five-month world tour of the United States, Europe, South America, and Australia.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Unveils New Band String Theories|url = http://www.blabbermouth.net/news/steve-vai-unveils-new-band-string-theories/|website = Blabbermouth.net|date = 2007-05-23|accessdate = 2015-12-27|language = en-US|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105070447/http://www.blabbermouth.net/news/steve-vai-unveils-new-band-string-theories/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> While evaluating unique options for the band (which included ideas for a [[horn (instrument)|horn]] section or [[percussion instrument|percussion]] section), Vai began auditioning violin players to complement the new lineup. This new band, known as the String Theories band, featured previous The Breed members Jeremy Colson (drums) and Dave Weiner (guitar and sitar), along with new members [[Bryan Beller]] (bass), Alex DePue (violin), and [[Ann Marie Calhoun]] (violin). During a month of twelve- to fifteen-hour a day rehearsals, Vai and the band perfected the performance (which consisted of pieces from Vai's catalog, arranged by Vai to include the two violins).<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Unveils New Band String Theories|url = http://bravewords.com/news/steve-vai-unveils-new-band-string-theories|website = bravewords.com|accessdate = 2015-12-27|language = en-US|deadurl = no|archiveurl = http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20151229111646/http://bravewords.com/news/steve-vai-unveils-new-band-string-theories|archivedate = December 29, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> The tour began in June 2007 and ended in December the same year.
Midway through the String Theories tour in 2007, Vai recorded a performance at the [[State Theatre (Minneapolis)|State Theatre]] in [[Minneapolis]], which yielded the acclaimed 2009 live concert DVD and Blu-ray release of ''[[Where the Wild Things Are (Steve Vai album)|Where the Wild Things Are]]''. Certified gold in the United States and Canada, ''Where the Wild Things Are'' showcased the diverse musical range of the String Theories band, with pieces such as the visceral Grammy-nominated "[[Now We Run]]", to the dynamic ballad "Angel Food".<ref>{{Cite web|url =https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2245526/|title =IMDb- Where The Wild Things Are|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|deadurl =no|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2245526/|archivedate =January 5, 2016|df =mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Where the Wild Things Are - Steve Vai {{!}} Songs, Reviews, Credits {{!}} AllMusic|url = http://www.allmusic.com/album/where-the-wild-things-are-mw0000825761|website = AllMusic|accessdate = 2015-12-27|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.allmusic.com/album/where-the-wild-things-are-mw0000825761|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
2007 also marked the 20th anniversary of the production of the Ibanez JEM guitar, a milestone which was commemorated with the 20th anniversary JEM model. Made of an acrylic body with three-dimensional "swirl painted" interior, this guitar can be seen in the beginning of the ''Where the Wild Things Are'' DVD. In 2008, Vai announced the release of his signature Ibanez Jemini [[distortion (music)#Overdrive.2Fdistortion pedals|distortion pedal]], a twin distortion pedal with both a custom overdrive and lead distortion section.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Review: Ibanez Jemini Steve Vai signature distortion pedal|url = http://iheartguitarblog.com/2011/04/review-ibanez-jemini-steve-vai-signature-distortion-pedal.html#sthash.kLtlOpWY.dpbs|website = I Heart Guitar|accessdate = 2015-12-27|language = en-US|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105020121/http://iheartguitarblog.com/2011/04/review-ibanez-jemini-steve-vai-signature-distortion-pedal.html#sthash.kLtlOpWY.dpbs|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
===2010–present=== [[Image:Steve Vai Zepparella 2017.jpg|thumb|right|Vai performing with Led Zeppelin tribute band [[Zepparella]], May 2017]] 2010 marked the twentieth anniversary of the production of the Ibanez Universe guitar, which was commemorated with a twentieth anniversary Universe model. A reissue of the early 1990s Universe 77 MC (multi-color swirl), the model included a new five-piece [[maple]]/[[guibourtia|bubinga]] Universe neck and original swirl-paint job by Darren Johansen (the painter of the original Universe 77 MC guitars).<ref>{{Cite web|title = Ibanez Universe 20th Anniversary Video! - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/ibanez-universe-20th-anniversary-video/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.vai.com/ibanez-universe-20th-anniversary-video/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
In February 2010, Vai announced the introduction of "VaiTunes", a platform used to release digital-only singles via [[iTunes]] and other digital media outlets.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|title = Discography-Vaitunes - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/discography-vaitunes/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160103230619/http://www.vai.com/discography-vaitunes/|archivedate = January 3, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> In April, Vai performed with [[Mary J. Blige]], [[Orianthi]], [[Randy Jackson]], and [[Travis Barker]] for a rendition of the Led Zeppelin classic "[[Stairway to Heaven]]", on the hit television show ''[[American Idol]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Mary J. Blige Builds A 'Stairway To Heaven' For 'Idol Gives Back'|url = http://www.mtv.com/news/1637570/mary-j-blige-builds-a-stairway-to-heaven-for-idol-gives-back/|website = MTV News|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.mtv.com/news/1637570/mary-j-blige-builds-a-stairway-to-heaven-for-idol-gives-back/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
October 2010 saw more movement from Vai as a composer, with the premiere of two original symphonies at the Steve Vai Festival in [[Groningen]], the Netherlands, and performed by the [[Noord Nederlands Orkest|North Netherlands Orchestra]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Festival! - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/steve-vai-festival-3/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.vai.com/steve-vai-festival-3/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> Shortly after the festival, Vai embarked on the Experience Hendrix tour (along with Eric Johnson, [[Kenny Wayne Shepherd]], [[Susan Tedeschi]], [[Billy Cox]], [[Vernon Reid]], [[Robert Randolph and the Family Band|Robert Randolph]], [[Jonny Lang]], [[Brad Whitford]], and others) for a nationwide tour of the United States.<ref>{{Cite web|title = A brief history of Experience Hendrix Tour's 2010 Fall National Tour|url = http://www.experiencehendrixtour.com/history.php?event=014|website = Experience Hendrix Tour|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151231011118/http://www.experiencehendrixtour.com/history.php?event=014|archivedate = December 31, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
In March 2011, Vai (in conjunction with the online education division of Berklee College of Music) set a [[Guinness World Records|Guinness World Record]] for the world's largest online guitar lesson.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Join the World's Largest Online Guitar Lesson with Steve Vai|url = https://online.berklee.edu/vai-live|website = online.berklee.edu|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/https://online.berklee.edu/vai-live|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> The lesson was held as a promotion for Berklee's online "Steve Vai Guitar Techniques" course, which Vai helped to construct.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Steve Vai Guitar Techniques Course - Berklee Online|url = https://online.berklee.edu/courses/steve-vai-guitar-techniques|website = online.berklee.edu|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/https://online.berklee.edu/courses/steve-vai-guitar-techniques|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref> In April 2011, Vai (along with music and technology entrepreneur [[Andy Alt]]) announced the launch of GuitarTV, an online streaming website dedicated to bringing free guitar-related content to the community of guitar players around the world.
Vai's eighth studio album, ''[[The Story of Light (Steve Vai album)|The Story of Light]]'', was released in August 2012 as the second installment in the ''Real Illusions'' concept album trilogy.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Album – The Story of Light - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/album-the-story-of-light/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227135232/http://www.vai.com/album-the-story-of-light/|archivedate = December 27, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref> ''The Story of Light'' tour, which began on the month of the album's release, spanned 254 engagements in 52 different countries, ending in September 2014. This tour yielded the 2015 release of Vai's fourth live DVD project ''Stillness in Motion'', filmed in October 2012 during his ''Story of Light'' tour at the [[Club Nokia]] in Los Angeles. Released on April 7, the double-disc set contained a copy of the ''Stillness in Motion'' concert footage and a special bonus feature disc called ''The Space Between the Notes''. The latter is a complete chronological timeline of the ''Story of Light'' tour, with a video or picture representation of each show of all of the 254 engagements attended.<ref>{{Cite web|title = "Stillness In Motion" DVD and CD Release for April 7, 2015 - vai.com – The Official Steve Vai Website|url = http://www.vai.com/stillness-in-motion-dvd-and-cd-release-for-april-7-2015/|website = www.vai.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160105123103/http://www.vai.com/stillness-in-motion-dvd-and-cd-release-for-april-7-2015/|archivedate = January 5, 2016|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
2014 saw the announcement of a new, intensive guitar camp called the "Vai Academy", which was an evolution of the Alien Guitar Secrets masterclass. Each year the camp is held, Vai creates a syllabus with a particular theme and invites special guests to help him teach it. During the day, Vai and the special guests (of whom have included [[Guthrie Govan]], [[Jeff Baxter]], Vernon Reid, Eric Johnson, [[Sonny Landreth]], and others) hold classes in which they add their insight and perspective to the theme. Each evening, Vai and the special guests jam with the campers. The themes have included 2014's Vai Academy- Song Evolution Camp, and 2015's Vai Academy: All About the Guitar.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Vai Academy 2015 - All About The Guitar|url = http://vaiacademy.com|website = vaiacademy.com|accessdate = 2015-12-28|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151231005633/http://vaiacademy.com/|archivedate = December 31, 2015|df = mdy-all}}</ref>
Vai has announced an upcoming 2016 release commemorating the 25th anniversary of ''Passion and Warfare''. This release will contain [[remaster]]ed songs from the album, as well as the inclusion of a new album of material written from the time between the recording of ''Passion and Warfare'' and his first solo album ''Flex-Able''. After the release, Vai will hold a world tour in which he will play the entire ''Passion and Warfare'' album, along with material from the new release.
